requirements landscaping $100000 $25 no test 2 arborist $250000 $25 no test 2 gradingutilities $500000 $25 no test 4 outside utilities contractor $1000000 $25 no test 4 sewerdrain maintenance $250000 $25 no test 1 demolition $250000 $25 no test 2 c qualification requirements 1 applicants desiring to obtain a contractors license must have the required level of experience and successfully pass the appropriate wyoming trades certification program test or the appropriate icc test on the table above see also this chapter 2 any license application or renewal postdated after december 31 for the upcoming year will be assessed a twentyfive dollar $2500 filing fee in addition to the amount shown in the above table 3 any licensed contractor may do required work that is incidental to the licensed work as approved by the building official example concrete footing for sign not requiring engineering 4 confirmation of experience will be confirmed by w2 records pay stubs insurance records copies of prior licenses workers compensation records other means of verification will be considered 5 any unlisted contractors test type fees and insurance will be reviewed by building official 6 apprenticeship cards for plumbing and mechanical may be obtained from the building official for work verification purposes only 7 subsequent to the adoption of the ordinance codified in this chapter all new applicants for a contractors license must meet the new requirements as adopted contractors renewing a license must meet the requirements as originally licensed 8 if a contractors license lapses for more than sixty 60 days for any reason the applicant must apply for a new contractors license and meet all the requirements as a new applicant 9 applicants meeting the licensing requirements may take the appropriate trades test if applicant fails the test the test may be retaken thirty 30 days from the last test date if the applicant fails again the applicant may retake that test every ninety 90 days thereafter 10 any applicant protesting a licensing decision made by the building official may appeal that decision to the board of appeals part 2008 part 2005   application procedure a application for license shall be made at the planning department upon review and approval by the administrative authority or hisher authorized representative and on payment of the required fee the city clerk shall issue the appropriate license the license application required in this section shall contain 1 applicants name  2 business address zip code and telephone number  3 type of license desired  4 refrigeration contractors must provide a copy of federal refrigeration certification  5 statelicensed electrical contractors must provide a photocopy of current state of wyoming electrical license  6 owners name residence address and telephone number  7 managers name residence address and telephone number  8 year for which such license is sought  9 proof of liability insurance in the minimum amount as stated in this chapter  10 any other relevant information required by the terms of the provisions pertaining to the license sought  11 proof of experience as outlined in this chapter b nonissuance of licenses shall entitle the applicant to a full refund of the fee part 2008 part 2005   proof of ability and experience a anyone wishing to obtain a city contractors license must provide proof of ability and experience in the construction discipline for which the license is sought proof of ability will consist of successful completion of a certification test wyoming trades certification program or the appropriate icc test if available b proof of experience will be verified by w2 records pay stubs insurance records prior contractor licenses or workers compensation records any other verification may be considered at the discretion of the building official part 2005   expiration of license all licenses shall expire with the calendar year in which the same are issued and all licenses shall be issued on a calendar year basis only part 2005   partial payment prohibited no partial payment shall be accepted by the city clerk for any license fee part 2005   suspension or revocation of license a suspension the building official may suspend a contractors license if the contractor commits any of the following acts or omissions 1 failure to pay within a reasonable amount of time any city fees generated from the contractors business license shall be suspended until such time as fees and any penalties have been paid to the city clerk  2 any licensed contractor whose liability insurance or bond is suspended for any reason shall automatically have hisher contractors license suspended once the city has been notified of lapse in coverage the building official shall then notify the contractor in writing of the suspension  3 any wilful intentional or continuing violations of municipal andor construction codes in any such instance the license will be a reinstated upon proof of compliance to the satisfaction of the building official or b subject to revocation according to the revocation procedures of this section  4 a twentyfive dollar $2500 reinstatement fee shall be assessed and the license reinstated when proof of current documentation for license has been provided to the building official b revocation the building official may recommend to the city council the revocation of a license when the licensee commits one 1 or more of the following acts or omissions 1 failure to comply with any of the licensees responsibilities as outlined in this chapter  2 knowingly combining or conspiring with any person by permitting ones license to be used by such a person  3 by acting as agent partner associate or in any other capacity with any persons to evade the provisions of the adopted construction codes or municipal code  4 wilful intentional or continuing violations of municipal or construction codes c when any of the acts or omissions as enumerated in this section are committed by a licensee and the building official deems that such license should be revoked the procedure shall be as follows 1 the licensee shall be notified in writing by certified mail at least seven 7 days prior to the city council meeting  2 when a hearing is requested by the building official the licensee will be notified of the time date and place  3 when a hearing is conducted the licensee and other interested parties may be in attendance  4 upon completion of the hearing the council will take all evidence admitted under advisement and shall notify the licensee of their findings and ruling in writing by certified mail the hearing shall be conducted as required by the wyoming administrative procedures act part 2005   reserved editors note adopted  repealed which pertained to exceptions and derived from   part 2005 cable television franchiseregulation of rates   purpose this chapter governs the regulation of rates for basic service and equipment within the city and does not replace a as amended the provisions set forth below are intended to be consistent with all federal communications commission fcc regulations governing the regulation of basic service rates and equipment and the city will regulate and interpret its rules so that they are consistent with fcc regulations as if those regulations were set forth in full herein  the franchisee is prohibited from engaging in any activity it is prohibited in engaging in under fcc rules as if those rules were set forth in full herein if enforcement of any provision would be prohibited under fcc rules the provision shall not be enforced but all other provisions shall remain in full force and effect for purposes of these provisions the term basic service or basic cable service has the same meaning as the term basic service at 47 cfr  and the term equipment refers to all equipment and services subject to regulation under 47 cfr  1 1993   initial filingswhen made a franchisee that is notified that its basic service and equipment rates are subject to regulation must file a submission the rate filing within thirty 30 days of the notification but is not required to make a filing any earlier than  justifying its thenexisting basic service and equipment rates all rates for all customer classifications must be justified once a franchisee has been so notified by the city that its rates are subject to regulation it may not thereafter increase its rates for basic service or equipment without the prior approval of the city this requirement applies in all cases including with respect to increases in rates announced prior to the date the operator was notified its rates were subject to regulation where the increases were not implemented prior to the date of notice a franchisee must submit a rate filing to justify any increase in basic service or equipment rates or any new basic service or equipment rate collectively referred to herein as rate increases an increase occurs when there is an increase in rates or a decrease in program or customer services rate filings proposing and supporting rate increases must be filed for review at least thirty 30 days in advance of the proposed effective date of the increase this requirement does not alter or eliminate any other notice requirement  1993   initial filingwhere made every rate filing must be submitted to the city clerk of douglas 101 north fourth street po box 103 douglas wyoming 82633 a rate filing shall be considered filed for review on the date the rate filing and all required copies are received by the city clerk three 3 copies of each rate filing including all supporting materials must be submitted if any part of the rate filing contains information that is claimed to be proprietary under applicable fcc rules the franchisee also must file three 3 copies with the proprietary information removed  1993   initial filingcontents a subject to any fcc regulations governing the burden of proof a rate filing submitted by a franchisee must show that the rates the franchisee proposes to charge for basic service and equipment are reasonable except as inconsistent with fcc rules 1 every rate filing must clearly state in a cover letter whether it justifies existing rates  or proposes an increase in rates the cover letter must also identify any rate that is derived in whole or in part based upon cost of service and identify any pages of the rate filing that contain information that the franchisee claims is proprietary it must state whether any part of the proposed increase is based on an inflation adjustment or an alleged increase in external costs the cover letter should also contain a brief narrative description of any proposed changes in rates or in service 2 the pages of each rate filing must be numbered sequentially 3 the rate filing must contain all applicable fcc forms and these forms must be correctly completed 4 if different rates are being charged or are to be charged for different customers or classes of customers the filing must show that the classifications and the differences in the rate charged are reasonable and consistent with federal law b if the franchisee seeks to support a rate based upon a cost of service the city will establish a rate that provides the franchisee an opportunity to recover its reasonable costs including a reasonable profit an expense or investment is not presumed reasonable merely because the franchisee has incurred or made it a franchisee is not entitled to recover monopoly rents in any form c in addition to information the city requires the franchisee to provide and unless the city grants a waiver of this provision a franchisee who seeks to justify all or any part of its rates based upon its cost of service must submit a complete cost of service analysis that shows all expenses it incurs and all revenues derived from the system directly or indirectly by the franchisee or any person that constitutes a cable operator of the system within the meaning of 47 usc 4 the cost of service must identify the accounting level as that term is used in the fccs regulations at which each expense or revenue identified was aggregated and show clearly how the expense or revenue was allocated the franchisee may not include costs at an accounting level unless it also includes all revenues from that same level attributable to the system or to a group of systems of which the system serving the city is a part the replacement cost of a comparable system must be identified and supported the franchisee must identify the name and address of any entity with which it has a contract other than a programmer which derives revenues from the system and must state whether and how the revenues of that entity were included in the cost of service in addition the cost of service shall clearly show the derivation of a proposed charge per channel and the application of that charge to yield a basic service rate it must also show and support the derivation and allocation of any amounts included in the derivation of the rate for 1 operation and maintenance expenses  2 administrative and general expenses  3 programming expenses identifying retransmission consent costs and copyright fees separately  4 costs for peg access and any institutional network  5 franchise fee expenses  6 investment in the system and associated depreciation  7 other expenses including federal state and local taxes itemized  and 8 the proposed return on equity and actual interest expense paid by the franchisee d notwithstanding the foregoing a franchisee is not required to submit the cost of service specified in subsection c of this section for equipment rates and instead initially shall complete submit and support the costs of equipment using applicable fcc forms any costs of service submitted to justify basic service rates must show that the cost of service does not include equipment costs  1993   initial city review a after receiving a rate filing the city promptly shall publish a notice that a filing has been received and that except for those parts which may be withheld as proprietary it is available for public review the notice shall state that interested parties may comment on the filing and shall provide interested parties at least seven 7 days to submit written comments on the filing to the city the city shall submit the comments received and its recommendations for action to the city council and shall make those comments and recommendations available for public inspection the franchisee may submit a response to public comments or staff recommendations but must do so no later than five 5 business days after the staff recommendations are submitted to the city council and the franchisee the response shall be filed with the city and if submitted in a timely fashion the city shall forward a copy to the city council b within thirty 30 days of the date of the filing the city council shall issue a written order including an explanation which may be in the form of a resolution approving the proposed rate in whole or in part  denying the proposed rate in whole or in part  or tolling the proposed rate in whole or part if the city council tolls the rate in whole or in part its written order at least shall explain that it requires additional time to review the rate filing and state that the franchisee may cure any deficiency in its filing by submitting a supplementary filing as provided in with respect to existing rates tolling means the rates may remain in effect subject to refund  with respect to rate changes tolling means the portion of the rate change that is tolled may not go into effect 2 1993   supplementary filings a if a proposed rate is tolled in whole or in part the franchisee shall submit a supplementary filing twenty 20 days from the date the tolling order issues containing corrections if any to its filing including any required supplement to its cost of service filing and any response to information filed by interested parties or to the recommendations of the city and any additional information supporting the proposed rate supplementary filings must be filed in accordance with b a supplementary filing also must contain such information as the city directs the franchisee to provide c in addition to information the city requires the franchisee to provide and unless the city grants a waiver of this provision a franchisee who claims that it is entitled to a rate in whole or in part based upon the adjustments for inflation and external costs contemplated by 47 cfr dl2 must submit the following 1 a calculation showing how each part of the adjustment was derived  2 a statement itemizing each external cost as defined by fcc regulations the amount of the external costs for the two 2 calendar years prior to the date of the filing and the yeartodate in which the filing is made  and the projected amount of the external cost for the remainder of the year in which the filing is made and for the following calendar year the statement must specifically show any increases in revenues from programming services revenues includes all revenues in whatever form received  3 if the increase is attributable to any increase in programming service costs the contract for each programming service whose cost has increased  a sworn statement identifying each programming service whose costs increased where the programmer is an affiliate of the franchisee as defined by fcc regulations   and for any contract that has been in effect less than twelve 12 months the prior contract for the service  4 a sworn statement by the franchisees chief financial officer or an independent certified accountant stating that he or she has examined all external costs including all programming costs and has offset against any increase claimed the amount of any decreases in external costs and the amount by which any increase in external costs was below the gnppi as required by 47 cfr d2  affirming that the franchisee has only sought to recover any external cost to the extent that costs exceeded the gnppi  and affirming that the franchisee has not attempted to recover any increase in the cost of programming purchased by an affiliate except as provided in 47 cfr d2vi d upon receiving the supplementary filing the city promptly shall publish a notice that a filing has been received and that it is available for public review except those parts which may be withheld as proprietary the notice shall state that interested parties may comment on the filing and shall provide interested parties twenty 20 days to submit written comments on the filing to the city the city clerk shall submit the comments received and the recommendations of the staff for action to the city council the recommendations shall be made available for public inspection the franchisee may submit a response to public comments or staff recommendations but must do so no later than ten 10 days after the staff recommendations are submitted to the city council the response shall be filed with the city clerk and if submitted in a timely fashion shall be forwarded to the city council e the city council shall issue a written order including an explanation which may be in the form of a resolution approving the proposed rate in whole or in part  denying the proposed rate in whole or in part  or allowing the rate to go into effect in whole or in part subject to refund if the city council issues an order allowing the rates to go into effect subject to refund it shall also direct the franchisee to maintain an accounting in accordance with 47 cfr  f the order specified in subsection e of this section shall be issued ninety 90 days after the tolling order for any rate the franchisee justifies based on the fcc benchmark the order shall be issued within one hundred fifty 150 days of the tolling order for any rate the franchisee justifies with a cost of service showing 3 1993   rate orderseffective datepublic notice any rate order of the city council shall be effective upon the passage of the resolution related thereto each rate order shall be released to the public and franchisee in any case where the city council approves denies or tolls a rate  orders that a rate may go into effect subject to refund  or orders refunds or establishes rates a public notice shall be published stating that the order has issued and is available for review any such order shall be in writing 1 1993   rate ordersprotection of public interest the city council may take any steps that it is not prohibited from taking by federal law to protect the public interest as part of any rate order or by any other means by way of illustration and not limitation it may require refunds set rates and impose forfeitures and penalties directly or delegated representatives and enforce refund orders any order prescribing a rate must explain why the franchisees proposed rate was unreasonable and why the prescribed rate is reasonable however before prescribing a rate or ordering a refund to subscribers the city council shall ensure the franchisee has had notice and opportunity to comment on the proposed rate or refunds if the recommendations of the city propose a refund or a rate then mailing a copy of the recommendation to the franchisee at the time it is submitted to the city council shall be deemed to provide the franchisee this notice and the franchisee must comment on the refund or rate in its response to the recommendations 2 1993   rate ordersreduction and refund no order approving or setting a rate using the fcc benchmarks shall be interpreted to establish the just and reasonable rate to subscribers every such rate approved or established shall be subject to further reduction and refund to the extent permitted under applicable laws and regulations as the same may be amended from time to time by way of illustration and not limitation should the fcc reduce the benchmarks the city shall have the right to reduce a franchisees rates and to require the franchisee to refund any amounts collected above the benchmark except to the extent prohibited by federal law 3 1993   franchisees duties a a franchisee must implement remedial requirements including prospective rate reductions and refunds within sixty 60 days of the date the city council issues an order mandating a remedy b within ninety 90 days of the date an order mandating a remedy is issued a franchisee must file a certification signed by an authorized representative of the cable company stating 1 whether the franchisee has complied fully with all provisions of the city councils order  and 2 describing in detail the precise measures taken to implement the city councils order  and 3 showing how refunds including interest were calculated and distributed c it is each franchisees responsibility to keep books and records of account so that it can refund any amounts owed to subscribers d if is each franchisees duty to submit as complete a filing as possible and knowingly withholding information or making a filing that is incomplete under applicable law shall be treated as an evasion of this chapter e information requests 1 a franchisee and any other entity that has records of revenues or expenses that are allocated to the franchisees system must respond to requests for information from the city by deadlines established by the city a franchisee is responsible for ensuring that such other entity responds to the citys requests 2 because federal law limits the time available for an initial response to a filing by a franchisee before the order contemplated by the franchisee must be prepared to respond to requests for information regarding its filing within five days of the date an information request is delivered to franchisee the information may include the information the franchisee would be required to provide as part of any supplementary filing  1993   duties of the city administrator a the city administrator or his designee shall be responsible for administering the provisions herein without limitation and by way of illustration 1 the city administrator or his designee shall ensure notices are given to the public and each franchisee as required herein and by fcc regulations 2 the city administrator or his designee may submit requests for information to the franchisee and establish deadlines for response to them as provided in  for good cause the city administrator or his designee may waive any provision herein or extend any deadline for filing or response except as to such matters that are mandatory under fcc regulations 4 the city council shall rule on any request for confidentiality 5 the city administrator or his designee shall prepare the recommendations to the city council contemplated by  if the city administrator or his designee recommends that any increase be denied in whole or in part it shall a propose a rate and explain the basis for its recommendation it may propose that rates remain at existing levels  and b recommend whether and on what basis refunds should issue  and c notify the franchisee of its recommendation at the time it is submitted to the council  1993   penalties and forfeitures a except as prohibited by federal law a franchisee shall be subject to penalties and forfeitures under subsection b of this section below and its request for approval of a rate may be denied if it 1 knowingly submits false or fraudulent information to the city in connection with any rate proceeding  2 fails to comply with any lawful order or request of the city including but not limited to a request for information or an order setting rates  or 3 evades or attempts to evade federal or local rate regulation  provided that filing for approval of a rate that is later determined to be unreasonable is not in and of itself an evasion of federal or local rate regulation b penalties and may include any one any combination or all of the following in an appropriate case 1 criminal penalty fine of not more than seven hundred fifty dollars $75000 for each violation may be imposed each day that a violation continues shall constitute a separate offense for which a separate fine may be imposed 2 civil penalty a civil penalty equal to onethirtieth  130  of the gross monthly receipts for basic services from all subscribers of the city may be imposed for each day a violation continues 3 forfeiture in cases where no other remedy is effective to stop the violation or provide a proper remedy a forfeiture of the franchise may be ordered by the city council 4 in any case where the city takes legal action including the filing of suit in an appropriate form judicial or administrative to enforce any lawful order or request of the city or any provisions of these regulations the franchisee shall pay the reasonable attorneys fees incurred by the city 5 no criminal fine civil penalty or attorneys fee award set forth in this section shall be recoverable by the franchisee in a cost of service rate determination or otherwise  1993   proprietary information a if these provisions or any request for information requires the production of proprietary information the franchisee must produce the information however at the time the allegedly proprietary information is submitted a franchisee may request that specific identified portions of its response be treated as confidential and withheld from public disclosure the request must state the reason why the information should be treated as proprietary and the facts that support those reasons the request for confidentiality will be granted if the city council determines that the preponderance of the evidence shows that nondisclosure is consistent with the provisions of the freedom of information act 5 usc 552 the city shall place in a public file for inspection any decision that results in information being withheld if the franchisee requests confidentiality and the request is denied 1 where the franchisee is proposing a rate increase it may withdraw the proposal in which case the allegedly proprietary information will be returned to it  or 2 the franchisee may seek review within five 5 working days of the denial in any appropriate forum release of the information will be stayed pending review b any interested party may file a request to inspect material withheld as proprietary with the city council the city council shall weigh the policy considerations favoring nondisclosure against the reasons cited for permitting inspection in light of the facts of the particular case it will then promptly notify the requesting entity and the cable franchisee that submitted the information as to the disposition of the request it may grant deny or condition a request the requesting party or the franchisee may seek review of the decision by filing an appeal with any appropriate forum disclosure will be stayed pending resolution of any appeal  1993   petition for change in status any franchisee may petition for a change in status in accordance with 49 cfr  and the city shall consider that petition in accordance with 49 cfr  the petition and three 3 copies must be filed with the city  1993 cable television franchisecustomer service standards   local office franchises shall maintain a business office in the city the office must be open for walkin traffic at least twentyfour 24 hours per week monday except legal and company holidays for purposes of conducting all normal business activity including receiving payment of bills scheduling appointments receiving returned converters and other equipment receiving complaints and the like 1 1993   telephone service a local or tollfree telephone lines must be staffed at least eight 8 hours per day monday to answer customer inquiries and to schedule service or repair calls when the telephone lines are not staffed ie after designated telephone hours a telephone answering service or answering device shall be used to provide at least emergency referral service including how to respond to outages twentyfour 24 hours a day seven 7 days per week b under normal operating conditions the telephone answering time including wait time and the time required to transfer the call shall not exceed thirty 30 seconds this standard shall be met for not less than ninety 90 percent of the calls received measured on an annual basis c under normal operating conditions ninetyfive 95 percent of calls to franchisee measured on an annual basis will not encounter a busy signal or delay in reaching any answering service or answering device d under normal operating conditions the rate of lost calls shall not exceed four and onehalf 412 percent measured on an annual basis e if automated answering equipment is used the equipment will limit the number of routine rings to four or fewer 2 1993   courtesy employees must be welltrained to respond courteously to all inquiries and complaints and franchisee must maintain a program for monitoring employee courtesy and responsiveness 3 1993   response to service calls and other inquiries a under normal operating conditions franchisee shall respond to service calls at least ten 10 hours per day monday except legal and company holidays in addition franchisee shall respond to major system outages disruptions of service to multiple customers within a specific geographic area on a twentyfour 24 hour basis seven 7 days per week franchisee shall also respond to minor system outages from eight  am to ten  pm seven 7 days per week the hours set forth above shall be modified to take into consideration the safety and security precautions necessary for all of franchisees employees b under normal operating conditions repair and maintenance for service interruptions or other repairs not requiring onpremises in the home work must be initiated within twentyfour 24 hours of receipt of the inquiry or complaint c franchises shall offer either a specific appointment time or designated blocks of time at its election if the franchisee designates blocks of time franchisee shall give the subscriber the option of selecting at least one predesignated block of time for service appointments monday within the deadlines set forth in subsections a and b of this section or at the customers election on saturday in the event that the available blocks of time are not convenient for the subscriber the parties shall agree upon a mutually acceptable block of time at a later date the blocks initially shall be am eight  am to twelve  am or pm one  pm to end of service day but as soon as practicable franchisee shall offer subscribers the option of selecting one 1 predesignated three 3 hour block of time for service appointments if at any time an installer or technician is running late an attempt to contact the subscriber will be made prior to the time of the appointment and the appointment will be rescheduled if necessary d under normal operating conditions franchisee shall initially respond to all other inquiries including billing inquiries and to all other complaints within five 5 business days of the receipt of the inquiry or complaint e under normal operating conditions franchisee shall respond in the times specified in subsections b d of this section and b in ninetyfive 95 percent of the cases measured on a calendar year basis f franchisee may not levy a charge for repair or maintenance except in cases of subscriber negligence or abuse of franchisees equipment g in addition to providing for converter and other equipment return at the local business office monday the franchisee shall arrange for either or both saturday return or pickup of converter and other equipment  1993   information to subscribers a general information franchisee must provide to each subscriber prior to installation of service reconnection  or upon request information with regard to the following subscriber privacy rights  how to use the cable service  general services offered by franchisee such as maintenance service  billing procedures  how to use the converter  and federal theft of service law b in addition to this information the following information shall also be provided to each subscriber prior to installation of service reconnection or upon request cable systems office hours and local or tollfree phone number including if different the afterhour number  name or title of franchisees employee responsible for resolving complaints  the telephone number of the city office responsible for administering the franchise along with a statement that the office can be called to register a complaint if the subscriber is dissatisfied with the actions taken by franchisee  a listing of all the channels offered on the system and the price of all services and equipment being offered by the cable system  the franchisees obligations and procedure for scheduling a service call  the amount of any deposit required by franchisee and when and in what manner the deposit will be refunded  a description of the circumstances under which the subscriber is entitled to a refund or a rebate and how the refund or rebate can be obtained  and the franchisees policies and procedures for handling complaints and inquiries and specifically describing procedures for receiving and handling complaints about employee rudeness or nonresponsiveness c annual privacy notice on an annual basis franchisee shall mail to each subscriber notice of subscriber privacy rights as required by federal law d annual mail insert on an annual basis franchisee shall provide information required in subsections a and b of this section and mail to all subscribers e other notices in addition to the notices required by any other ordinance before it alters services or the manner in which services are provided franchisee must provide a reasonably simple and clear written notice explaining the substance and full effect of the alteration including the effect on rates and service options except where a change is beyond the control of franchisee a change is not beyond the franchisees control merely because it is directed by an entity that directly or indirectly controls franchisee such written notice shall be provided to the city at least sixty 60 days and to subscribers at least thirty 30 days before the service change f copies a copy of the notices provided to all subscribers under subsections a of this section shall be provided to the city g promotional materials all promotional materials regarding residential cable services to subscribers and the general public where price information is listed in any manner shall clearly and accurately disclose price terms in the case of payperview or payperevent programming all promotional materials must clearly and accurately disclose price terms and in the case of telephone order franchisee shall take appropriate steps to ensure that franchisee customer service representatives clearly and accurately disclose price terms to potential customers in advance of taking the order the franchisee shall maintain a public file containing all the promotional material  1993   disconnectiondowngrades a a subscriber may terminate or downgrade service at any time franchisee shall promptly disconnect or downgrade the services of any subscriber who so requests no period of notice prior to voluntary termination or downgrade of service by a subscriber may be required no charge may be imposed by franchisee for a cable service delivered after the date of a request for disconnection or downgrade of that service however franchisee may continue to levy a pro rata equipment charge on any equipment the subscriber is required to return to franchisee if the equipment is not returned within five 5 business days after the date of disconnect request b no charge may be imposed for any disconnection any charge for a downgrade will not exceed the average amount over the last full calendar year actually received for upgrades except that an additional reasonable downgrade charge may be imposed where a promotion requires a subscriber to take a service for a set and limited period of time in order to qualify for the promotion in such cases in addition to satisfying any requirements of the subscriber shall be notified in writing before the service is installed 1 that a downgrade charge will result if the subscriber downgrades before the end of a designated period and 2 the amount of the downgrade charge the notice can be provided in the franchisees promotional materials provided that it is clearly and prominently displayed c after disconnection upon payment by the subscriber in full of all proper fees or charges including the payment of the reconnection charge if any franchisee shall promptly reinstate service however if the subscriber is disconnected under subsection d of this section franchisee may refuse to reconnect unless it receives adequate assurance that the subscriber will not engage in the practices which led to disconnection d franchises may disconnect a subscriber immediately if the franchisee in good faith determines that 1 a on a thirty 30 day billing cycle at least thirty 30 days have elapsed from the first day of the billing period  if the billing cycle is longer at least thirty 30 days have elapsed from the date the subscriber began receiving the service for which is was billed and b the subscriber was given at least ten 10 days advance written notice of franchisees intention to discontinue service  provided however that said notice was separate and later from the bill in subsection d1a above and c the subscriber has failed to pay all amounts owed including any applicable administrative or similar fee by the date of disconnection and d no pending inquiry exists regarding the bill to which the franchisee has not responded in writing  2 the subscriber has tampered with or abused company equipment  or 3 the subscriber is not authorized to receive cable service or is facilitating aiding or abetting the unauthorized receipt of cable service by others  or 4 if subscriberinstalled or attached equipment is resulting in signal leakage which violates fcc rules the franchisee may disconnect a subscriber without the requisite notice e no charge may be made for reconnection where a subscriber is improperly disconnected by franchisee reconnection charges cannot be higher than the lowest standard installation charge which would be collected at the time of reconnection from similarly situated new subscribers  1993   complaint procedures franchisee shall establish a clear procedure for resolving complaints involving at least the following a a simple procedure for making complaints orally or in writing and identification of a person responsible for handling complaints which are not being resolved by a customer service representative b under normal operating conditions franchisee must provide its initial response to a complaint within five 5 business days of its receipt and a final written response to any unresolved complaint other than a complaint about the carriage or the lack of carriage of a particular programming service or about the content of a programming service or about the level of any unregulated rate within thirty 30 days after the complaint is made  1993   interruption of service franchises shall make best efforts to schedule maintenance consistent with reasonable and customary practices so that activities likely to result in an interruption of service are performed so as to minimize the extent of any such interruption except in emergency situations service may only be interrupted after a minimum of fortyeight 48 hours prior notice to subscribers and the city administrator of the anticipated service interruption notice to the city administrator shall be given orally or in writing  provided however planned maintenance which is not expected to require more than two 2 hours interruption of service or which occurs between the hours of midnight and six  am shall not require such notice  1993   billing practices and customer charges a itemized bills every franchisee bill to subscribers must itemize each category of service and state clearly the charge therefor b late bills bills are not late and an administrative fee or similar charge may not be imposed until at least the fifteenth day of the period for which the service being billed is provided subscribers shall not be charged an administrative fee or similar charge for any failure by the franchisee its employees or contractors including failure to timely or correctly bill the subscriber or failure to properly credit the subscriber for a payment timely made c charges on late bills franchisee may not assess a charge on late bills to cover the expected cost of disconnection franchisee may not charge a late fee in excess of four dollars $400 d unsolicited goods or service 1 definitions a goods mean those which are or may be obtained primarily for personal family or household purposes and include services but not insurance b mistake means unintentionally providing or sending goods to subscribers c notice requirements shall mean i the subscriber shall receive one 1 notice at least twentyfive 25 but not more than fortyfive 45 days in advance of the effective date of the delivery of goods clearly and conspicuously a describing the specific goods to be delivered  b stating the price of the goods to be delivered  c informing the subscriber that the goods will cease to be delivered unless the subscriber informs the provider that the goods are wanted  and d informing the subscriber of at least two methods at least one of which is expensefree by which the subscriber can inform franchises of hisher desire to receive the goods  ii the first bill containing a charge for the goods provided hereunder or a separate notice enclosed therewith shall clearly and conspicuously advise the subscriber of the inclusion of the charge on the bill for the services and subscribers right to cancel those goods within ten 10 days of the receipt of the bill at no cost to the subscriber for the period during which those goods were provided prior to effective cancellation  and iii in no event shall the subscriber be required to cancel the goods to avoid the charge prior to ten 10 days after the subscribers receipt of the first bill containing the charges for those goods provided hereunder for purposes of a cancellation by mail the cancellations shall be effective upon the date of mailing the request for cancellations d person includes individual corporation partnership association or any other legal entity e preauthorization agreement means a written agreement between franchisee and a subscriber of those goods under which the subscriber agrees to accept and pay for goods to be identified in the future unless the subscriber notifies the provider of hisher desire not to accept and receive such goods all in accordance with the notice requirement f send includes deliver mail provide cause to be sent mailed or delivered g unsolicited goods means any goods which are sent without prior expressed request or consent from the person receiving the goods h unsolicited goods does not include i goods sent or services performed by mistake  ii a gift given free of charge to a subscriber  iii additions to existing goods or level of goods already provided to subscribers for which there is no separate and specific charge for such additions  iv restructuring in accordance with the notice requirements of existing goods or services or levels of services already provided to subscribers where the restructuring does not result in a substantial change in goods or services  and v goods sent pursuant to an agreement that is in compliance with 16 cfr  franchisee shall not a send a subscriber unsolicited goods unless the franchisee proves the goods were sent by mistake as a gift or as a result of the subscribers prior expressed request or consent  b send any bill to a subscriber for any unsolicited goods  c interrupt terminate cancel or deny delivery of or other provision of goods to a subscriber because the subscriber has not paid for or returned unsolicited goods  d require a subscriber to consent to or authorize the receipt of unsolicited goods as a condition of doing business with franchisee e franchisee may require a reasonable nondiscriminatory deposit on equipment provided to subscribers as follows 1 if the subscriber returns the equipment franchisee must return the deposit plus interest to the date the deposit is returned but less any amount which franchises can demonstrate should be deducted for damage to that equipment interest shall accrue at the same rate the city pays on utility deposits but no interest needs to be paid on deposits held less than three months the city must give notice to the franchisee of a change in the interest rate 2 the deposit and interest shall be returned to the subscriber within the next billing cycle of the date the equipment is returned f charges every customer service charge must be reasonable  1993   refunds a for every period where franchisees service is interrupted or substantially impaired not due to circumstances completely beyond the franchisees control for one hour or more franchisee on subscribers request and upon notice at the time of such interruption shall credit to the subscribers account an amount equal to onethirtieth  130  of the monthly charge for any service or service tier affected the charge for any perprogram selection which is materially affected by the outage will be refunded b if any subscriber terminates service prior to the end of a prepaid period a pro rata portion of any prepaid service fee using the actual number of days in the month as a basis shall be refunded to the subscriber c all refunds shall be made promptly but not later than the next billing cycle following the date of the request which gives rise to the refund or  in the case of a refund upon termination the return of any equipment belonging to the franchisee  1993   privacy a franchisee shall at all times comply with the privacy provisions of the cable act b no penalties or extra charges may be invoked for a subscribers failure to grant permission under the privacy provision of the cable act  1993   normal operating conditions defined the phrase normal operating conditions means conditions that do not present an undue hazard to the franchisees property or the health of its employees or agents considering the nature of the work to be performed and franchisees duty to provide reliable service for example the parties recognize that there will be weather conditions under which the franchisee could not be expected to open its office or conduct repairs  1993 title 6  animals animals and fowl in general   definitions a as used in this chapter unless the context otherwise indicates the following shall have the meanings specified in this section 1 animal means any vertebrate creature excluding man 2 fowl means live fowl turkeys ducks geese or carrier pigeons  11262012   running at largeprohibiteddeclared nuisance no cattle horses hogs sheep or goats or chickens ducks geese turkeys guinea fowl or any other fowl or animal except as provided in this chapter shall at any time be permitted to run at large or range within the corporate limits of the city or within any cemetery or park or upon any ground owned leased or controlled by the city for any purpose whatsoever any of such animals found running at large in the city or running or ranging within any of the prohibited places mentioned in this section are declared to be nuisances any person having charge of or being the owner or agent of any such animal at large within the city or any of such prohibited places shall be deemed the author of a nuisance and subject to penalty as provided in this chapter this chapter shall not be construed to interfere with the city in leasing for grazing purposes any land owned or controlled by the city  1980   running at largeimpoundment if any animal or fowl referred to in be found running at large or running within any of the places referred to in to the regulations of this chapter it is the duty of a police officer or the animal control officer to take up and cause the same to be confined in a secure pen pound or other place provided for that purpose the release of animals and the payment of impoundment fees is controlled by   1980   breaking open pound no person shall directly or indirectly break open or assist in breaking open any pen or enclosure with the intention of releasing any animal confined therein pursuant to the provisions of this chapter  1980   cruelty to animals it is unlawful for any person to overdrive overload drive when overloaded overwork or wilfully and maliciously torture torment harass badger bully or terrorize deprive of necessary sustenance cruelly beat mutilate or kill needlessly poison abandon permit any dogfight cockfight bullfight or other combat between animals or to carry in a cruel or inhumane manner any animal or to cause any of these acts or omissions to be done it is unlawful for any person owning an animal to fail to provide it with proper and adequate food and drink which consists of access to drink and food and to fail to provide the animal with necessary protection from extreme weather and medical attention and treatment to prevent suffering or to cause any of the acts or omissions to be done ownership or the commission of such acts of cruelty on private property shall not be justifiable defense for violation of this chapter part 2000  16 1980   injury of domestic animaldrivers responsibility the driver of any motor vehicle involved in an accident resulting in injury to a domestic animal shall immediately stop and render such assistance as may be possible and shall take reasonable steps to notify the owner of the animal or give notice of such accident to the local police department or the city animal control department part 2000   keeping certain animals within city limits the keeping of animals shall be permitted and regulated pursuant to the provisions of this chapter and 7 of the unified land development   part 1992  1980  11262012   8102015    keeping of certain animalspermit a the keeping stabling and corralling of fowl horses hogs sheep llamas cows goats ponies mules and donkeys and other similar barnyard animals without a valid permit in any zoning district other than a agriculture or rr rural residential is considered a nuisance b the keeping of animals within the city limits is governed by the conditional use permit procedures in of the unified land development part 1995 part 1992  1980  11262012   8102015  dogs and cats   definitions as used in this chapter unless the context otherwise indicates the following shall have the meanings specified in this section a abandon means to withdraw necessary care and support from any animal or to desert any animal upon any property public or private b animal means any vertebrate creature excluding man c altered animal means an animal which has been spayed or neutered d at large includes any animal which is off the premises of the owner and is in a public park upon developed school property or upon public or private property without permission of the property owner a dog is not at large when it is under control by means of a leash less than ten 10 feet long with strength proportionate to that of the dog attached held by a person capable of managing the dog at large includes any dog in the bed of a parked and unattended pickup truck in the areas described in the first sentence of this section if the dog is not physically restrained so that it is unable to reach the side of the bed e bite means a puncture tear or indentation of the skin inflicted by the teeth of an animal f clean means premises which do not have an offensive odor  do not have an excessive number of flies or other insects  and do not otherwise cause any unsanitary conditions in the enclosures or the surroundings where the animals are kept g euthanized means termination of an animals life by means recommended by a licensed veterinarian h kennel means any place where more than three 3 dogs or cats regardless of sex are harbored or kept for commercial purposes i licensed animal means any animal wearing a collar city of douglas license and proof of current rabies vaccination j nuisance means any animal which trespasses on public or private property  is at large damages soils or defecates on private or public property  causes garbage which was previously placed in a garbage or refuse container to be strewn or deposited on private or public property  habitually constantly or frequently disturbs the sleep rest tranquility or peace of any neighborhood or person  any animal which creates offensive odors disturbing to any neighbor or person k owner means any person or persons firm association or corporation owning keeping or harboring any animal of whatever kind or nature domesticated or undomesticated harbor or keep means to own feed or provide shelter for any animal whether or not the animal spends its full time upon or near the premises of the person or persons said to own the animal whether or not the person said to own the animal provides food or shelter for the animal on a daily basis and irrespective of the method by which the animal came to be owned harbored kept fed or sheltered by the person said to own the animal l premises means real and personal property of the owner of the animal m surrender means forfeiture by the owner of ownership and possession to the city n undeveloped land means land on which no aboveground or onground improvements have been constructed except those associated with the animals currently being kept on the property public parks cemeteries and playing fields are not undeveloped land o vicious animal means any animal that constitutes a physical threat to human beings domestic animals or both or menaces persons or other animals in any public or private place without just provocation part 2000 part 1987  1980   license and registration required a all dogs or cats kept harbored or maintained by their owner within the city shall be licensed and registered if over the age of six 6 months dog or cat licenses shall be issued by the city clerk or authorized agent the term of this license shall be valid for the calendar year in which it is issued the owner shall state at the time application is made for such license and upon printed forms provided for such purpose his name and address and the name breed color and sex of each dog or cat kept by him b if an animal is not licensed as provided by this chapter and said animal is impounded by the animal control officer the owner or person claiming the animal shall pay the required fee to release the animal from impoundment the necessary shots and other medical attention required to meet the licensing requirements as required by the animal control division and if ownership or control can be established over the animal before the time of impoundment by the person claiming the animal the person claiming the animal shall be liable for the penalties as set forth in violations of the licensing ordinance of the city part 2000  1980   tag and collar the clerk or authorized agent shall issue to the owner a license certificate and metallic tag for each dog or cat so licensed the shape of the tag shall be changed every year and shall have stamped thereon the year for which it was issued and the number corresponding with the number on the certificate every owner shall see that the collar and tag are constantly worn in case a dog or cat tag is lost or destroyed a duplicate will be issued by the clerk or authorized agent upon presentation of a receipt showing proof of vaccinations for the current year dog or cat tags shall not be transferable from one dog or cat to another or from one owner to another part 2000  1980   vaccination for rabies as part of the application for dog or cat licenses the person making such application must before a license shall be issued exhibit to the licensing authority a certificate signed by a licensed veterinarian that the dog or cat for which the license is to be issued has been vaccinated with an antirabies vaccine immunizing the dog or cat against rabies for a period equal in time to or in excess of the term of the license applied for  1980   display of license tag every owner or harborer of a dog andor cat shall attach the tag evidencing the licensing and inoculation thereof to the collar or harness of the licensed dog or cat and such collar or harness shall be worn by such dog or cat at all times the licensing therefor shall be retained by the owner or harborer of the licensed dog or cat for inspection by any member of the police department or other authorized official at any reasonable time  1980   running at large prohibited it is unlawful for the owner of any dog or cat to allow such dog or cat to be at large upon any property public or private not the premises of the owner any dog or cat on any such property shall be considered to be at large and in violation of this section  1980   confinement of certain dogs if any dog is found running at large in violation of this provision it shall be taken up and impounded and shall not be released except upon approval of authorized personnel after payment of fees provided in provided however that if any dangerous fierce or vicious dog so found at large cannot be safely taken up and impounded such dog may be slain by any police officer or other authorized official an animal shall be deemed a vicious animal in the case of any attack upon any person or property outside the premises of the owner of the animal part 2000   impoundment of animals the animal control officer appointed by the city shall have the power and is authorized and directed to take into custody and impound any animal declared in this chapter or other ordinance of the city to be a public nuisance and take into custody and impound any dog or cat found running at large within the city no animal held in custody shall be kept without suitable food and clean drinking water furnished as deemed necessary but a minimum of once each day and no animal so held shall be subjected to any unnecessary suffering or discomfort it is the duty of the animal control officer shelter maintenance worker andor the administrative authority to exercise reasonable care for the safety and welfare of the animal held by him or her and to employ no unnecessarily cruel or inhumane means of controlling or destroying the animals if an animal is injured or seriously ill and the owner cannot be immediately located the animal control officer shelter maintenance worker or an administrative authority shall have authority in the owners absence to contract with a licensed veterinarian for all necessary and reasonable care for such injured or seriously ill animal upon the veterinarians recommendations the administrative authority may authorize euthanasia part 2000  1980   impoundmentperiod of confinementeuthanasia a the animal control officer or other authorized person shall place all apprehended animals in the city animal shelter or other authorized facility which shall be provided suitable for the purpose of keeping dogs and cats and other animals and shall keep the same for a period hereinafter specified or until such sooner time as the owner of the animal shall properly apply to pay all impound fees and license fees for the animals release b the period of confinement of animals placed in the city animal shelter prior to their destruction or their adoption shall be as follows 1 surrendered animals a surrendered animal shall be available for immediate adoption and shall be kept at the animal shelter a minimum of seven 7 days for possible adoption unless the owner surrenders the animal because of viciousness or bad temperament feral cats and other animals which are reasonably determined by the animal control officer veterinarian or the shelter operator to be vicious in nature or of bad temperament may be euthanized 2 unlicensed animals all unlicensed animals with the exception of cats shall be kept in the custody of the shelter for a period of not less than five 5 days or one hundred and twenty 120 hours and all unlicensed cats shall be kept in the custody of the shelter for a period of not less than three 3 days or seventytwo 72 hours from the time of impound any such unlicensed animal may be placed with the general population of the shelter and is not required to be held in a separate quarantine facility shelter may order the vaccination of any unlicensed animal prior to placing same with the general shelter population owner shall reimburse payment of any costs incurred if unlicensed animal is claimed following vaccination or other care and feeding costs after the expiration of the five 5 days or one hundred twenty 120 hours the shelter operator may authorize the destruction of the animal by such humane means as may be provided or make the animal available for adoption all unlicensed animals will be checked for alternate methods of identification tattoos microchips etc prior to being destroyed or placed for adoption such checks will be documented and placed with the animals file 3 licensed animals the shelter shall keep all licensed animals for a minimum of seven 7 days or one hundred sixtyeight 168 hours after notification of the registered owner in accordance with this chapter  however in the event it is for one 1 reason or another impossible for the shelter to notify the registered owner the shelter shall be authorized to destroy or make the animal available for adoption seventytwo 72 hours after receiving the return receipt from the certified mail advising that the notification was undeliverable or refused 4 legal ownership the original owner after the period of confinement loses all rights to the animal a person who meets adoption criteria as set forth in the animal shelter procedures becomes the animals legal owner after payment of the adoption fee proper inoculation spaying and neutering if necessary and licensing of the animal part 2006 part 2003  part 2000 part 1991   1980  4232012   adoption adoption of any animal shall be by a person deemed by the shelter operator at the designated animal shelter to be a responsible and suitable owner who will agree to comply with the provisions of this chapter and all amendments thereto as well as any reasonable adoption conditions set forth by the animal shelter no animal shall be released until fees have been paid and adoption contract executed part 2006 part 2003   part 2000 owner if he or she is known or can be determined such notification can be made in person or by telephone if all attempts to notify the owner have failed the animal shelter will send a notification via certified mail to the owners last known address part 2006 part 2000  1980   impoundmentreleasepayment of fees a the person entitled to the possession of any animal impounded as provided in this payment for each day or any part of day of impoundment the animal shall be released to the animals legal owner or representative animals owned by outofcounty residents shall not be required to obtain city or county licenses prior to release of such animal b the shelter maintenance worker shall not be empowered to release any dog or cat to the public without the approval of the animal control officer or other administrative authority in the event such animal appears to be infected or is infected with rabies hydrophobia mange or other infectious or contagious disease or diseases such release shall be granted only upon certification at the owners expense by a licensed veterinarian that the animal is not infected or diseased if found to be infected or diseased the animal may be 1980   vicious animal no person or company shall keep cause to be kept harbor sell or give away any vicious animal in the boundaries of the city proof of the fact that the animal has bitten or attacked any person or other animal at any place where a person or animal is legally entitled to be is evidence that the animal is vicious within the meaning of this act part 1987   disposal order in the interest of the health safety and general welfare of the residents of the city the municipal judge may order that the owner dispose of an animal which has been judged vicious or a habitual violator upon failure of the owner to comply with such an order of the municipal judge within twentyfour 24 hours after rendition the animal control officer or administrative authority shall take such animal into custody forthwith and dispose of it immediately in carrying out a written order signed by the municipal judge the animal control officer or administrative authority may go upon any property public or private within the city part 2000   muzzling whenever it becomes necessary to safeguard the public from the dangers of hydrophobia or any other outbreak of disease the mayor if he or she deems it necessary shall issue a proclamation ordering every person owning or keeping an animal to confine it securely on his or her premises unless such animal shall have a muzzle of sufficient strength to prevent it biting any person during the period of proclamation any unmuzzled animal will be impounded even if under the control of the owner or other competent person if said animal is outside the premises unmuzzled even if on a leash any and all animals that are noticeably affected with rabies or other diseases which could be dangerous to people and displaying vicious propensities shall be killed by the animal control officer or any police officer or other authorized person without notice to the owner the owner of any animal seized during this period shall be liable for all fines and impoundment costs provided for in this chapter  1980   chasing or noisy dogs it is unlawful for the owner of any dog licensed or unlicensed to allow such dog to chase for whatever reason or purpose and irrespective of the dogs intent or vicious nature motor vehicles motorcycles bicycles or persons on foot or to bark howl or whine which barking howling or whining disturbs the peace and quiet of the neighborhood any dog as defined in this section is declared to be a public nuisance  1980   commercial kennels a a person maintaining a commercial kennel must purchase a kennel license commercial kennel shall be defined pursuant to of the unified land development it is unlawful for any person or persons to keep or maintain a commercial kennel in an area not zoned for such use commercial kennel operations will fall under those restrictions governed by a conditional use permit pursuant to of the unified land development commercial kennels shall also comply with the usespecific standards in of the unified land development issuance of a kennel license is only allowed when the kennel is in full compliance with the unified land development part 2000  1980   8102015    removal of feces requiredexception a notwithstanding other provisions in this title it is unlawful for the owner or any other person accompanying a dog or cat to cause or permit the dog or cat to be on public or private property not owned or possessed by such person unless such person has in his or her immediate possession a device or implement with which to remove dog or cat feces and a container or implement to use in transporting the feces to a garbage or refuse disposal can it is unlawful for the owner of a dog or cat or other person accompanying the dog or cat to fail to remove the dog or cat feces from public or private property not owned or possessed by such person to a garbage or refuse disposal can this subsection does not apply upon undeveloped land b this subsection shall not apply to a person who is visually or physically handicapped to a degree which renders such person physically incapable of complying with this section part 2000   appointment of shelter maintenance worker and animal control officer the chief of police may appoint an animal control officer pursuant to the city personnel rules and regulations compensation shall be compatible with the salary structure for all city employees part 2006 part 2003  part 2000  1980   dog or other animal biteexamination it shall be the duty of the animal control officer when a complaint or notice is received that a dog or other animal has bitten a person other than on the premises of owner to take the animal into custody immediately and at the expense of the owner to confine the animal under observation of a licensed veterinarian for a period of fourteen 14 days or for such other period of time that the veterinarian at his or her discretion may designate if after the examination the animal is found not to have rabies it may be returned to its owner upon payment by him or her of all fees and charges if however at any time during the examination the animal was found to have rabies it shall be destroyed and disposed of with the advice and under the instruction of the veterinarian if the biting animal is on the property or premises of the owner at the time of the bite it shall be left to the discretion of the animal control officer as to how the animal is to be held in quarantine the animal may either be held by a chain or other approved restraining device on the property of the owner for a period of fourteen 14 days or for an adequate period of time as determined by a licensed veterinarian or it may be taken to the pound or clinic to be held for a full fourteen 14 days or there may be a written report by a veterinarian stating why the animal should not be held in quarantine for the full fourteen 14 days   1980   entry to private property pursuant to nuisances and in the enforcement of any of the provisions of this chapter the animal control officer or member of the police department may and is authorized to enter the premises of any person and take possession of any animal licensed or unlicensed when in pursuit of such animal at the time the animal goes upon private property part 2000  1980   molesting of confined animals any animal confined by a fence leash rope chain or other enclosure within the boundaries of the premises of the owner of the animal shall be safe from annoyance and molestation any person other than the owner of the animal who shall in any manner annoy molest or disturb any animal so confined or who shall open any gate or other opening in a fence or other enclosure within which the animal is confined or in any manner disturb any enclosure is guilty of a violation of this chapter the portion of this section prohibiting persons other than the owner from opening gates and fences the opening of which is necessary to gain access to the premises shall not apply to persons authorized to enter such premises as for the purpose of delivering merchandise ordered by such owner or of reading any meter placed upon the premises for the purpose of measuring merchandise already consumed by such owner part 2000  1980   molesting animals in city shelter it is unlawful for any person to annoy molest or disturb any animal confined in the city animal shelter or to open any gate or other opening in a fence or other enclosure within which the animal is confined or in any manner to disturb any enclosure operated by the city to contain and confine animals under the provisions of this chapter part 2000  1980   enforcement powers of officers and shelter maintenance worker in the enforcement of any of the provisions of this chapter the appointed animal control officer or any member of the police department is herewith specifically authorized to enforce any and all provisions of this chapter whether or not named specifically as the enforcement officer in each respective section of this chapter part 2006 part 2003  part 2000  1980   keeping of pets declared revocable privilege it is declared that the keeping of animals for pets within the city is a privilege which may be revoked for one 1 year from time of decision of the city in the event of continued or repeated violations of the animal control ordinances of the city or in the event the keeping or harboring of dogs cats or other animals shall constitute a public nuisance as specified in part 2000  1980   report of stray animals no person shall without the knowledge or consent of the owner hold or retain possession of any animal for more than fortyeight 48 hours without reporting the possession of such animal to the shelter maintenance worker animal control officer or the police department giving his or her name and address and description of the animal part 2000 public nuisances   prohibited no person or persons within the city shall keep harbor or maintain any animal or animals which by virtue of their size number or other characteristics constitute a public nuisance in the neighborhood or a health hazard within the city part 2000  part 1980   complaint hearingorder to abate upon complaint being filed with the municipal court of the city charging any person or persons with maintaining a public nuisance in accordance with this chapter the municipal judge shall set a hearing in the municipal court giving notice to both the complaining party or parties and the person accused of maintaining a public nuisance after a full and complete court hearing the municipal judge shall have the authority to order the abatement of the nuisance and in this regard the abatement of the nuisance includes but is not limited to ordering the defendant or the authorized personnel of the city to destroy or otherwise remove one 1 or more of the dogs cats or other animals from the premises or from the city part 2000  part 1980   evidence of a nuisance for the purposes of this section any one 1 of the following circumstances but not limited to the following circumstances shall be considered prima facie evidence of a public nuisance a unclean means premises which have an offensive odor an excessive number of flies or other insects or otherwise is in an unsanitary condition  b the failure of the defendant to keep his or her dog cat or other animal or animals on his or her own premises  c excessive continuous noise from barking howling or meowing of cats dogs or other animals  d wherever the number of dogs cats and other animals or the size of the animals is disproportionate to the size of the premises owned by the defendant or where the facilities for the care of the animals are disproportionate to their reasonable needs part 2000  part 1980 penalties   penalties any person convicted under this title shall be fined any sum not to exceed seven hundred fifty dollars $75000 such fine is in addition to any impound fees or other expenses that are chargeable part 2000 part 1987   1980 title 8  health and safety fireworks   prohibitions except as otherwise provided in this chapter it is unlawful for any person to barter sell or give away to any person within the city any firecracker or other form of fireworks as defined in of the wyoming state statutes except as otherwise provided in this chapter no person shall fire explode or use any of the things prohibited in this section within the city part 1999 prior code  1117   authorization of public fireworks displays the fire chief with concurrence from the city administrator may authorize public displays of fireworks  provided that the manner and time of such displays shall meet with the requirements set forth in ws  3510203 part 1999 prior code  1118  1 3132017   application fees  waiver of fees a each person or organization applying for a fireworks permit shall submit written application on forms provided by the city with payment of the permit fee in the amount of twentyfive dollars $2500 to the city clerk said fees shall be nonrefundable b the city administrator may waive the application fees for communitywide fireworks display events  2 3132017 flammable liquids generally   definitions for the purposes of this article the following words and phrases shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them by this section a gasoline means any product of petroleum or any hydrocarbon liquid that will flash or emit an inflammable vapor below the temperature of one hundred degrees fahrenheit 100 b gas station means a property used for the retail sale of gasoline diesel fuel oil or other fuel for vehicles and which may include as incidental accessory uses the retail sale of vehicle accessories minor vehicle repair facilities a convenience store and a carwash    8102015    storage of inflammable liquidsdoor regulations at service stations a it is unlawful for any person to keep for sale or store any gasoline kerosene naphtha distillate fuel oil crude oil or other inflammable and combustible liquids within the corporate limits of the town except in accordance with the rules and regulations of the national board of fire underwriters and subject to the written approval first being had and obtained from the town council b no door except overhead doors on the premises of any of the gasoline service stations mentioned in this article shall be equipped with a snap locking device in addition to the regular door handle and all doors for the exit and entrance of persons shall have only one 1 door knob or other device which will permit anyone inside the building to open the door in the case of emergency with the use of only one 1 hand c storage of flammable andor hazardous substances shall comply with the requirements of of the unified land development    8102015    containers for storage of inflammable petroleum products it is unlawful for any service station to keep for sale or to store any inflammable or combustible petroleum product on the premises of such station unless the same is kept and stored in a sealed metal container or in a container that is metal and equipped with a screwtype opening and closing device which device shall be tightly closed nothing in this section shall prohibit the storing of such products in approved tanks    maximum quantity of inflammable liquids to be stored no person
