allowed to delay installation or corrective action for more than ninety 90 days from date of inspection this time period may be shortened depending upon the degree of hazard involved c failure to comply with the designated deadline shall subject the water user to a termination of water services within a period not to exceed five 5 days for failure to comply with the requirements of this section in the event the water user informs the city of extenuating circumstances as to why the correction has not been made a time extension may be granted by the department but in no case will it exceed one thirty 30 day extension d if the city determines at any time that a serious threat to the public health exists the water service may be terminated immediately and without prior notification part 2004   standards for installation of backflow prevention assemblies a before any backflow prevention assembly is installed for the prevention of backflow the city shall first approve such assembly assembly shall be installed and tested for conformity with recognized standards acceptable to the city which are consistent with the international plumbing city utility construction specifications and department of environmental quality regulations b existing backflow prevention assembly installations that are not approved shall be replaced with an approved assembly within ninety 90 days written notice from city c approved assemblies shall not be modified in any way after the assembly leaves the manufacturers factory if installation is not completed by a plumber licensed with the city completed installation shall be inspected by a plumber licensed with the city upon completion of installation or inspection the licensed plumber shall notify the city of the installation d installation requirements complying with the international plumbing be followed in access and clearance for the required testing maintenance and repair of all assemblies part 2004   testing and maintenance a it is the duty of the water user of any premises protected with a testable backflow prevention assembly to have such assembly tested annually or as directed by the city at the water users expense b any assembly that leaks malfunctions or fails a test shall be repaired or replaced and retested upon notification of such failure by the tester andor written notice from the city of the failure within five 5 working days of receipt of such notice high hazard situations will not be allowed to continue unprotected if the backflow preventer fails the test and cannot be repaired immediately c the city reserves the right to spot check and test any containment assembly at any time to verify the proper operation and test results of the assembly d the water user shall be responsible for the payment of all fees for permits device testing retesting in the case that the device fails to operate correctly and second reinspections for noncompliance with city requirements part 2004   right of entry the city utility department director or hisher designee shall during normal business hours and upon display of proper credentials have the right to enter all buildings being served from the public water system for the purpose of inspection of crossconnections and existing or potential hazards the right of entry shall be a condition of continuing water service in order to provide assurance that the health safety and welfare are maintained for the community within the water distribution system of the city part 2004   violations failure of the water user to cooperate in the installation maintenance testing or inspection of backflow prevention assemblies required by the ordinance codified in this chapter shall be grounds for the termination of water service to the premises water service may be terminated by the city if unprotected crossconnections exist on the premises when any defect is found in an installed backflow prevention assembly or if the backflow prevention assembly has been removed or bypassed water service may be terminated service shall not be restored until such conditions or defects are corrected termination of service may be summary immediate and without written notice whenever in the judgment of the city such action is necessary to protect the purity of the public potable water system supply or the safety of the water system part 2004 plant investment fees   determination of amountresponsibility a all charges for connection to the citys water system made pursuant hereto shall be paid by the owner of the property developer therein and to connect such facilities directly with the proper public water line in accordance with the provisions of this division and adopted public works standards within ninety 90 days after date of official notice to do so failure to separate services within the allotted time may result in a fine up to seven hundred fifty dollars $75000 the public works director or designee may extend the ninety 90 day deadline to separate services at his or her discretion b the city requires that any property or area to be served by the water system of the city be annexed into the city prior to the 2008  1983   billing status it is the responsibility of each property owner or tenant to notify the city of intent to change name discontinue begin or in any way alter billing requirements the water from the citys supply without first having established an account shall pay the city for the estimated water used plus pay the penalty of a fine not to exceed seven hundred fifty dollars $75000 for such unlawful taking of water water shall be shut off from such premises until such charges andor penalties are paid part 2008  1983   rates and charges a all metered structures shall be assessed a monthly water rate consisting of a customer service charge a demand charge and a commodity charge b the customer service charge shall be assessed to recover costs that apply equally to each user of the system regardless of demand or quantity used it shall be billed on a customer account basis c the demand charge shall be assessed to recover costs of debt service and replacement fund for water facilities it shall be based on the size of the customers meter or service as follows water meter size unit capacity value 34 inch 100 1 inch 100 15 inch 200 2 inch 32 3 inch 600 4 inch 1100 6 inch 3600 12 inch 14400 d the commodity charge shall be the amount charged a customer for the quantity of water used during a billing period e charges shall be made in accordance with the provisions of governing body the rates so determined shall remain in effect until or unless revised by any subsequent resolution   1983    2 7252011  res no 174 792012   monthly billing dates and delinquent accounts a property owner shall be responsible for payment of all utility bills unless property owner assigns tenant responsibility for payment of such bills such assignment shall be in writing all utility bills shall be sent to the property owner or tenant on a monthly basis all monthly charges for water shall be due and payable on the twentieth of each month if payment is not made by the twentieth of the month the account shall be deemed delinquent and account shall be subject to a five dollar $500 rebilling charge if payment is not received within thirty 30 days after initial billing a letter shall be sent to the owner and tenant at the mailing addresses on file the letter shall state 1 that the account is delinquent  2 that if the account is not paid in full on or before sixty 60 days after the initial billing giving the date of the sixtieth day the account shall be deemed in default and services discontinued  and 3 that the bill may be contested or challenged by contacting the city finance office giving address and telephone number prior to the fiftieth day after initial billing giving the date of the fiftieth day if payment of the account in full is not received or if the account is not settled within sixty 60 days after initial billing the account shall be deemed in default and services discontinued b any residential or commercial property owner or tenant who has had the water shutoff for nonpayment of utility charges shall pay the bill in its entirety for all utility charges including water sewer garbage landfill pest control etc and shall deposit with the city a sum equivalent to two 2 times the average monthly bill for all municipal utility services for that property prior to service being restored c for provisions concerning turnonturnoff fees see d all deposits shall be held for a period of one 1 year if the property owner or tenant demonstrates good faith in payment of bills in a timely fashion the deposit shall be returned e if the property owner or tenant cannot demonstrate good faith in payment of the bill the deposit shall be held by the city until such time of final billing final billing shall be made and deducted from moneys on deposit and any balance returned to the property owner or tenant the property owner or tenant shall be responsible for payment of the final bill in total if the deposit does not fully satisfy the debt to the city part 2008 part 2003  part 1994   1983 miscellaneous provisions   replacement account the city will establish and maintain a funded replacement reserve account throughout the useful life of the water supply and treatment works one hundred percent 100% of the estimated annual depreciation expense per year shall be credited to this reserve until a total of two million dollars $200000000 is accumulated this account may be used for replacement or repairs necessary to assure the supply treatment and distribution works reaching their useful life in the event any portion of the fund is used deposits shall be resumed to maintain the balance of two million dollars $200000000 part 2008 part 1997 part 1994  part 1984  1983   regulations promulgated by the governing body the governing body at its discretion may establish rules and regulations for watering distribution and operation of the water system as deemed fit and necessary this article when implemented by the governing body shall be enforced by the douglas police department  1983   access to meters and readout if a meter or remote readout cannot be read because of locked gates the presence of a dog or any other obstacle preventing the meter reader or any other agent of the city from obtaining a reading a written notice will be given to the owner to remove such obstacle and make the meter or readout accessible  1983   liability for negligence if any person other than authorized city personnel working on the citys water distribution system in any manner damages destroys or causes the city system to be drained of water that party shall be responsible and liable for the loss of any water and such additional fee or costs as determined by the city shall be assessed accordingly part 2008  1983   restriction on watering a if in the opinion of the governing body city administrator or the utility department director watering restrictions are deemed necessary such hours of restricted use shall be determined by the seriousness of the water shortage public notice shall be given utilizing all reasonable media b any violation of the hours for watering is declared to be unlawful and such violation of any regulation shall be punishable by a fine not to exceed seven hundred fifty dollars $75000 part 2008  1983 division ii  sewer system general requirements and information   duties of governing body subject to the laws relating to public utilities the governing body shall fix all rates for sewer charges septic waste disposal facility charges connection fees and for services to users within the service area of the city and make regulations for the collection of the fees and charges  1993  1983   powers and duties of town administrator the town administrator or his authorized representative shall enforce all necessary rules regulations and penalties to enforce the collection of fees or for the protection of the property and rights pertaining to the towns wastewater system this authority shall include the power to make any administrative rules or regulations as may be necessary to remain in compliance with epa guidelines  1983   powers and authority of utility department director a the utility department director and other duly authorized employees of the town bearing proper credentials and identification shall be permitted to enter all properties for the purposes of inspection observation measurement sampling and testing pertinent to discharge to the community system in accordance with the provisions of this chapter and chapters 1324 of this title b the utility department director or other duly authorized employees are authorized to obtain information concerning industrial processes which have a direct bearing on the kind and source of discharge to the wastewater collection system the industry may withhold information considered confidential the industry must establish that the revelation to the public of the information in question might result in an advantage to a competitor c while performing the necessary work on private properties referred to in subsection a of this section the utility department director or duly authorized employees of the town shall observe all safety rules applicable to the premises established by the company and the company shall be held harmless of injury or death to the town employees and the town shall indemnify the company against loss or damage to its property by town employees and against liability claims and demands for personal injury for property damage asserted against the company growing out of the gauging and sampling operation except as such may be caused by negligence or failure of the company to maintain safe conditions as required d the utility department director and other duly authorized employees bearing proper credentials and identification shall be permitted to enter all private properties the town holds a duly executed easement for the purposes of but not limited to inspection observation measurement sampling repair and maintenance of any portion of the wastewater facilities lying within the easement all entry and subsequent work if any on the easement shall be done in full accordance with the terms of the duly executed easement pertaining to the private property involved  1983   interfering or tampering with wastewater treatment facilities no person shall maliciously wilfully or negligently break damage destroy uncover deface or tamper with any structure appurtenance or equipment which is a part of the wastewater facility any person found guilty of violating this provision shall be subject to a maximum fine of seven hundred fifty dollars $75000 not including any civil liability which may be determined for such damage  1983   falsifying information any person who knowingly makes any false statements representations or certification in any application record report plan or other document filed or required to be maintained pursuant to this division or who falsifies tampers with or knowingly renders inaccurate any monitoring device or method required under this division shall upon conviction be subject to the penalties as provided in the douglas municipal  1993 definitions   generally unless the context specifically indicates otherwise the meaning of terms used in this division of this title shall be as set out in this chapter ch2 part 1983   act or the act act or the act means the federal water pollution control act also known as the clean water act as amended 33 usc 125 et seq  part 1993   biochemical oxygen demand bod biochemical oxygen demand or bod means the quantity of oxygen utilized in the biochemical oxidation of organic matter under standard laboratory procedure in five 5 days at twenty degrees centigrade 202c expressed in milligrams per liter  1983   building drain building drain means that part of the lowest horizontal piping of a drainage system which receives the discharge from soil waste and other drainage pipes inside the walls of the building and conveys it to the building sewer beginning five 5 feet 15 meters outside the inner face of the building wall  1983   building sewer building sewer means the extension from the building drain to the public sewer or other place of disposal also called house connection lateral or service line  1983   combined sewer combined sewer means a sewer intended to receive both wastewater and storm or surface water not allowed in the town  1983   easement easement means an acquired legal right for the specific use of land owned by others  1983   floatable oil floatable oil means oil fat or grease in a physical state such that it will separate by gravity from wastewater by treatment in an approved pretreatment facility wastewater shall be considered free of floatable fat if it is properly pretreated and the wastewater does not interfere with the collection system  1983   garbage garbage means the animal and vegetable waste resulting from the handling preparation cooking and serving of foods  1983   hazardous waste hazardous waste is any waste listed as a hazardous waste in subpart d of the federal regulations  part 1993   holding tank waste holding tank waste means any domestic sanitary waste from holding tanks such as vessels chemical toilets campers trailers septic tanks and vacuumpump tank trucks  part 1993   industrial wastes industrial wastes means the wastewater from industrial processes trade or business as distinct from domestic or sanitary wastes  1983   interference interference means the inhibition or disruption of the wastewater treatment processes or operations which contributes to a violation of any requirement of the citys npdes permit  part 1993   natural outlet natural outlet means any outlet including storm sewers and combined sewer overflows into a watercourse point ditch lake or other body of surface or ground water  1983   normal domestic wastewater normal domestic wastewater means wastewater that has a bod concentration of not more than three hundred 300 milligrams per liter and a suspended solids concentration of not more than three hundred 300 milligrams per liter normal domestic wastewater is considered to have a concentration which will generally range from approximately one hundred twentyfive 125 to three hundred 300 milligrams per liter of both bod and suspended solids  1983   operation and maintenance operation and maintenance means expenditures during the useful life of the treatment works for materials labor utilities and other items which are necessary for managing and maintaining the sewage works to achieve the capacity and performance for which such works were designed and constructed  1983   person person means any individual firm company association society corporation or group  1983   ph ph means the reciprocal of the logarithm of the hydrogen ion concentration the concentration is the weight of hydrogen ions in grams per liter of solution neutral water for example has a ph value of seven 7 and a hydrogen ion concentration of 10 7   1983   pollutant pollutant means any dredged spoil solid waste incinerator residue sewage garbage sewage sludge munitions chemical wastes biological materials radioactive materials heat wrecked or discarded equipment rock sand cellar dirt and industrial municipal and agricultural waste discharged into water  part 1993   pollution pollution means the manmade or maninduced alteration of the chemical physical biological and radiological integrity of water  part 1993   properly shredded garbage properly shredded garbage means the wastes from the preparation cooking and dispensing of food that have been shredded to such a degree that all particles will be carried freely under the flow conditions normally prevailing in public sewers with no particle greater than onehalf 12 inch 127 centimeters in any dimension  1983   public sewer public sewer means a common sewer controlled by a governmental agency or public utility  a sewer main  1983   replacement replacement means expenditures for obtaining and installing equipment accessories or appurtenances which are necessary in the useful life of the treatment works to maintain the capacity and performance for which such works were designed and constructed the term operation and maintenance includes replacement  1983   residential contributor residential contributor means any contributor to the town treatment works whose lot parcel of real estate or building is used for domestic dwelling purposes only  1983   sanitary sewer sanitary sewer means a sewer that carries liquid and watercarried wastes from residences commercial buildings industrial plants and institutions together with minor quantities of ground storm and surface water that are not admitted intentionally  1983   septic waste septic waste refers to trucked or hauled nonhazardous sanitary domestic waste as defined by the environmental protection agency and the wyoming department of environmental quality  part 1993   septic waste disposal facility septic waste disposal facility means that facility designated for the discharge of domestic sanitary wastes into the citys wastewater treatment facility  part 1993   sewage sewage means that spent water of a community the preferred term is wastewater as defined in  1983   sewer sewer means a pipe or conduit that carries wastewater or drainage water  1983   shallmay shall is mandatory may is permissive  1983   sludge sludge means any solid semisolid or liquid waste generated from a municipal commercial or industrial wastewater treatment plant water treatment plant or air pollution control facility exclusive of the treated effluent from a wastewater treatment plant  part 1993   slug slug means any discharge of water or wastewater which in concentration of any given constituent or in quantity of flow exceeds for any period of duration longer than fifteen 15 minutes more than five 5 times the average twentyfour 24 hour concentration or flows during normal operation and shall adversely affect the collection system andor performance of the wastewater treatment works  1983   storm drainstorm sewer storm drain sometimes termed storm sewer means a drain or sewer for conveying water groundwater subsurface water or unpolluted water from any source  1983   suspended solids ss suspended solids or ss means total suspended matter that either floats on the surface of or is in suspension in water wastewater or other liquids and that is removable by laboratory filtering as prescribed in standard methods for examination of water and wastewater and referred to as nonfilterable residue  1983   treatment works treatment works means any devices and systems for the storage treatment recycling and reclamation of municipal sewage domestic sewage or liquid industrial waste these include items individual systems pumping power and other equipment appurtenances  extensions improvement remodeling additions and alterations thereof  elements essential to provide a reliable recycling supply such as standby treatment units and clearwell facilities  and any works including site acquisition of the land that will be an integral part of the treatment process or is used for ultimate disposal of residue resulting from such treatment  or any other method or system of preventing abating reducing storing treating separating or disposing of municipal waste or industrial waste including waste and combined stormwater and sanitary sewer system  1983   unpolluted water unpolluted water means water of quality equal to or better than the effluent criteria in effect or water that would not cause violation of receiving water quality standards and would not be benefitted by discharge to the sanitary sewers and wastewater treatment facilities provided  1983   useful life useful life means the estimated period during which a treatment works will be operating  1983   user charge user charge means that portion of the total wastewater service charge which is levied in a proportional and adequate manner for the cost of operation maintenance and replacement of the wastewater treatment works  1983   wastewater wastewater means the spent water of a community from the standpoint of source it may be a combination of the liquid and watercarried wastes from residences commercial buildings industrial plants and institutions together with any groundwater surface water and stormwater that may be present  1983   wastewater facilities wastewater facilities means the public structures equipment and processes required to collect carry away and treat domestic and industrial wastes and dispose of the effluent  1983   wastewater treatment works wastewater treatment works means an arrangement of devices and structures for treating wastewater industrial wastes and sludge the term is sometimes used as synonymous with wastewater treatment plant or water pollution control plant  1983   watercourse watercourse means a natural or artificial channel for the passage of water either continuously or intermittently  1983   water meter water meter means a water volume measuring and recording device furnished andor installed by the town  1983 use of public sewers required   deposit of garbage in unsanitary manner prohibited it is unlawful for any person to place deposit or permit to be deposited in any unsanitary manner on public or private property within the town or in any area under the jurisdiction of the town any human or animal excrement garbage or objectionable waste  1983   discharge of untreated wastewater prohibited it is unlawful to discharge to any natural outlet within the town or in any area under the jurisdiction of the town any wastewater or other polluted waters except where suitable treatment has been provided in accordance with subsequent provisions of this article  1983   onsite disposal system prohibited except as hereinafter provided it is unlawful to construct or maintain any privy privy vault septic tank cesspool or other facility intended or used for the disposal of wastewater  1983   trucked or hauled sanitary domestic septageseptic waste disposal facility a the discharge of trucked and hauled sanitary domestic septage except as provided in subsection d below by any individual firm or corporation is prohibited at any location except at the city septic waste disposal facility located at the city wastewater treatment plant b the septic waste disposal facility will accept only sanitary domestic waste from sanitary septic sources from the following sources 1 residential homes  2 domestic wastes from sanitary septic sources within a business  3 greases and oils from approved restaurantshotels with domestic sanitary wastes only c no oil field wastes produced waters or other chemically based waters used or found in the oil mining or other production process will be accepted d recreational vehicles and camper trailers may utilize designated septic waste dumping stations within the city limits to discharge sanitary waste holding tank contents not exceeding one hundred 100 gallons  part 1993   regulationseptic waste disposal facility the city council shall from time to time and by resolution adopt amend and update regulations and guidelines governing the use of the septic waste disposal facility the city council shall annually review the user charge system and revise the system as necessary to assure equity of the system and to assure that sufficient funds will be collected from the system to adequately operate and maintain the septic waste disposal facility failure to conduct the annual review shall be grounds for the initiation of a current review process only and shall not invalidate existing fee schedules which shall remain in effect until modified by affirmative council action  part 1993   connection to town wastewater system requiredannexation a the owners of all houses buildings or properties used for human occupancy employment recreation or other purposes situated within the town and abutting on any street alley or rightofway in which there is now located or may in the future be located a public sanitary sewer of the town is required at the owners expense to install suitable toilet facilities therein and to connect such facilities directly with the proper public sewer in accordance with the provisions of this article within ninety 90 days after date of official notice to do so provided that the public sewer is within two hundred 200 feet of the property line b the town requires that at the direction of the governing body any area served by the wastewater system of the town be annexed to the town or commit to annexation within one 1 year part 1997   1983 private wastewater disposal   when allowed where a public sanitary sewer is not available under the provisions of the building sewer shall be connected to a private wastewater disposal system complying with the provisions of chapters 1320 of this title  1983   permission requiredprocedure a before commencement of construction of a private wastewater disposal system the owners shall first obtain written permission from the governing body the request for such shall include any plans specifications and other information as are deemed necessary by the governing body the approval of the county sanitarian is also required permits for onsite wastewater disposal shall be issued by sanitarians office b a permit for a private wastewater disposal system shall not become effective until the installation is completed to the satisfaction of the county sanitarian the sanitarian shall be allowed to inspect the work at any stage of construction and in any event the applicant for the permit shall notify the sanitarian when the work is ready for final inspection and before any underground portions are covered  1983   connection to public sewer required when available at such time as a public sewer becomes available to a property served by a private wastewater disposal system as defined in a direct connection shall be made to the public sewer within ninety 90 days in compliance with division ii of this title and any septic tanks cesspools and similar private wastewater disposal facilities shall be cleaned of sludge and filled with sand  1983   responsibility for maintenance of private system the owners shall operate and maintain the private wastewater disposal facilities in a sanitary manner at all times at no expense to the town  1983   additional requirements of sanitarian no statement contained in this chapter shall be construed to interfere with any additional requirements that may be imposed by the county sanitarian or the county board of health  1983 building sewers and connections   permit required for work on sewer system no unauthorized persons shall uncover make any connections with or opening into use alter or disturb any public sewer or appurtenance thereof without first obtaining a written permit from the community development department for excavation in a city rightofway or other public land a rightofway permit shall be obtained from the community development department the permit shall cover such items as excavation materials backfill compaction replacement of asphalt or concrete paving replacement of curb gutter and sidewalks and any other materials required for complete restoration of the trenched area part 1997  1983   plant investment fee required a there shall be two 2 classes of building sewer permits class a for residential and commercial service  class b for service to establishments producing industrial wastes b in either case the owners or his agent shall make application on a special form furnished by the city the permit application shall be supplemented by any plans specifications or other information considered pertinent in the judgment of the community development and public works departments part 1997   1983   responsibility for costs of installation all costs and expenses incidental to the installation and connection of the building sewer shall be damage that may directly or indirectly be occasioned by the installation of the building sewer fees shall be as indicated in part 1997  1983   separate sewer service line required for each structure or dwelling unit a separate and independent sewer service line shall be provided for every building single family dwelling multifamily dwelling business structure or mobile home park condominiums townhouses andor duplex units shall be considered singlefamily units and shall have separate sewer service lines if each unit is individually owned or is capable of individual ownership   1983   old building sewers in new buildings old building sewers may be used in connection with new buildings only when they are found on examination of the community development department to meet all requirements of this chapter and no new tap is made to a city main part 1997  1983   proper design and construction of new sewer and connections a the size slope alignment materials of construction of all sanitary sewers and sewer connections and the methods to be used in excavating placing of the pipe jointing testing and backfilling the trench shall conform to the requirements of the building and plumbing code and other applicable rules and regulations of the city and the state b whenever possible the building sewer shall be brought to the building at an elevation below the basement floor in all buildings in which any building drain is too low to permit gravity flow to the public sewer sanitary sewage carried by such building drain shall be lifted by an approved means and discharged to the building sewer c the connections of the building sewer into the public sewer shall conform to the requirements of the building and plumbing code or other applicable rules and regulations of the city all such connections shall be made gastight and watertight and verified by proper testing any deviation from the prescribed procedures and materials must be approved by the community development department before installation d the applicant for the building sewer permit shall notify the public works department when the building sewer is ready for inspection and connection to the public sewer the connection and testing shall be made under the supervision of the public works department part 1997   1983  1 2132017   surface and groundwater drainage connection prohibitedexception no persons shall make connections of roof downspouts foundations drains areaways drains or other sources of surface runoff or groundwater to a building sewer or building drain which in turn is connected directly or indirectly to a public sanitary sewer unless such connection is approved by the public works department with concurrence from the city administrator approval may be subject to conditions or restrictions as determined by public works  2 2132017 editors note  2 adopted feb 13 201 repealed   and enacted a new   as set out herein the former   pertained to surface drainage connection prohibitedexceptions and derived from part adopted 1997  and  adopted 1983   safety precautions during excavationrestoration of premises all excavations for building sewer installation shall be adequately guarded with barricades and lights so as to protect the public from hazard streets sidewalks parkways and other public property disturbed in the course of the work shall be restored in a manner satisfactory to the town  1983   responsibility for maintenance all property owners connected to the towns wastewater treatment facility shall keep and maintain the lateral line from the building connection to the public sewer main and shall keep the line in good repair at their own expense the town shall not be responsible for payment of any claim resulting from the breakage of any line or for damage resulting from backup of sewer if the breakage or backup occurs in the lateral line  1983 use of public sewers   discharge of unpolluted waters prohibitedexception a no persons shall discharge or cause to be discharged any unpolluted waters such as stormwater groundwater roof runoff subsurface drainage or cooling water to any sewer except stormwater runoff from limited areas unless such connection is approved by the public works department with concurrence from the city administrator approval may be subject to conditions or restrictions as determined by public works b stormwater other than that exempted under subsection a of this section and all other unpolluted drainage shall be discharged to such sewers as are specifically designated as storm sewers or to a natural outlet approved by the public works director and other regulatory agencies or to a sanitary sewer with the approval of public works and concurrence of the city administrator as provided for in unpolluted industrial cooling water or process waters may be discharged on approval of the public works director to a storm sewer or natural outlet  1993  1983  3 2132017   specific pollutant limitations designated no person shall discharge any wastewater or other substance into the wastewater treatment plant containing the following substances in excess of the listed total concentration limitations limitation mgl discharges greater than 1% plant flow limitation mg1 discharges less than 1% plant flow _____ _____ arsenic 005 005 beryllium nd nd  cadmium 01 01 chromium 50 50 copper 32 32 lead 50 50 mercury 001 001 nickel 04 04 zinc 58 58 ndnot detectable at this concentration any other specific pollutants identified by the city may also have specific effluent permit limitations set by the city to restrict their discharge into the system  1993   prohibited materials designated no user shall contribute or cause to be contributed directly or indirectly any pollutant or wastewater which will interfere with the operations or performance of the wastewater treatment plant or septic waste disposal facility these general prohibitions apply to all such users of the wastewater treatment facility whether or not the user is subject to national categorical pretreatment standards or any other national state or local pretreatment standards or requirements a user may not contribute the following substances to the wastewater treatment plant or septic waste disposal facility a any liquids solids or gases which by reason of their nature or quantity are or may be sufficient either alone or by interaction with other substances to cause fire or explosion or be injurious in any other way to the wastewater treatment facility or to the operation of the wastewater treatment facility including but not limited to wastestreams with a closed cup flashpoint of less than one hundred forty degrees fahrenheit 140f or sixty degrees celsius 60c using test methods in 40 cfr 26121 as enacted or hereafter amended at no time shall two 2 successive readings on an explosion hazard meter at the point of discharge into the system or at any point in the system be more than five percent 5% nor any single reading over ten percent 10% of the lower explosive limit lel of the meter prohibited materials include but are not limited to gasoline kerosene naphtha benzene toluene xylene ethers alcohols ketones aldehydes peroxides chlorates perchlorates bromates carbides hydrides and sulfides and any other substances which the city the state or epa has notified the user is a fire hazard or a hazard to the system  b solid or viscous substances which may cause obstruction to the flow in a sewer or other interference with the operation of the wastewater treatment facilities such as but not limited to grease garbage with particles greater than onehalf 12 inch in any dimension animal guts or tissues paunch manure bones hair hides or fleshings entrails whole blood feathers ashes cinders sand spent lime stone or marble dust metal glass straw shavings grass clippings rags spent grains spent hops wastepaper wood plastics tar asphalt residues residues from refining or processing of fuel or lubricating oil mud or glass grinding or polishing wastes  c petroleumbased oil in sufficient enough amounts that cause passinterference to the system and in no cases exceeding one hundred 100 mgl  d any wastewater having a ph less than five 50 or greater than twelve 120 or wastewater having any other corrosive property capable of causing damage or hazard to structures equipment andor personnel of the wastewater treatment facility  e any wastewater containing toxic pollutants in sufficient quantity either singly or by interaction with other pollutants to injure or interfere with any wastewater treatment process constitute a hazard to humans or animals result in toxic gases vapors or fumes within the wastewater treatment facility in a quantity that may cause acute worker health and safety problems create a toxic effect in the receiving waters of the wastewater treatment facility or to exceed the limitation set forth in a categorical standard a toxic pollutant shall include but not be limited to any pollutant identified pursuant to a of the act  f any noxious or malodorous liquids gases or solids which either singly or by interaction with other wastes are sufficient to create a public nuisance or hazard to life or are sufficient to prevent entry into the public sewers for maintenance and repair  g any substance which may cause the wastewater treatment facilitys effluent or any other product of the wastewater treatment facility such as residues sludges or scums to be unsuitable for reclamation and reuse or to interfere with the reclamation process in no case shall a substance discharged to the wastewater treatment facility cause the wastewater treatment facility to be in noncompliance with sludge use or disposal criteria guidelines or regulations developed under of the act  any criteria guidelines or regulations affecting sludge use or disposal developed pursuant to the solid waste disposal act the clean air act the toxic substances control act or state criteria applicable to the sludge management method being used  h any substance which will cause the wastewater treatment facility to violate its npdes andor state disposal system permit or the receiving water quality standards  i any wastewater with objectionable color which cannot be removed in the treatment process such as but not limited to dye wastes and vegetable tanning solutions  j any wastewater having a temperature which will inhibit biological activity in the wastewater treatment facility resulting in interference but in no case wastewater with a temperature above sixtyfive degrees celsius 652c one hundred fifty degrees fahrenheit 1502f or a temperature that causes the wastewater treatment facility influent to exceed forty degrees celsius 402c one hundred four degrees fahrenheit 1042f  k any pollutants including oxygendemanding pollutants bod etc released at a flow rate andor pollutant concentration which a user knows or has reason to know will cause interference to the wastewater treatment facility in no case shall a slug load have a flow rate or contain concentration or quantities of pollutants that exceed limits set by the utility department director  l any wastewater containing any radioactive wastes or isotopes of such halflife or concentration as may exceed limits established by the superintendent in compliance with applicable state or federal regulations  m any wastewater which causes a hazard to human life or creates a public nuisance  1993  1983   powers of utility department director concerning abuse a if any waters or wastes are discharged or are proposed to be discharged to the public sewers any of the substances listed in subsections a m of such amounts as to have a deleterious effect upon the wastewater facilities processes equipment or receiving waters or which otherwise create a hazard to life or constitute a public nuisance the utility department director may 1 reject the wastes  or 2 advise the user of the impact of the contribution to the wastewater treatment facility  and 3 develop effluent limitations for such user to correct the interference with the wastewater treatment facility  4 require pretreatment to an acceptable condition for discharge to the public sewers  andor 5 require control over the quantities and rates of discharge  andor 6 require payment to cover added cost of handling and treating the wastes not covered by existing taxes or sewer charges b if the utility department director permits the pretreatment or equalization of waste flows the design and installation of the plants and equipment shall be subject to the review and approval of the community development department part 1997   1993  1983   federal categorical pretreatment standards upon the promulgation of the categorical standard for a particular industrial subcategory the standard if more stringent than limitations imposed under this division for sources in that subcategory shall immediately supersede the limitations imposed under this division the utility department director shall notify all affected users of the applicable reporting requirements under 40 cfr 40312 as enacted or hereafter amended  part 1993   state requirements to apply when state requirements and limitations on discharges shall apply in any case where they are more stringent than federal requirements and limitations or those in this division  part 1993   increasing or diluting discharge to avoid proper treatment prohibited no user shall increase the use of process water or in any way attempt to dilute a discharge as a partial or complete substitute for adequate treatment to achieve compliance with the limitations contained in the categorical standard or in any other pollutantspecific limitation developed by the city or state  part 1993   grease oil and sand interceptors grease oil catchbasins and sand interceptors shall be provided or modified when in the opinion of the utility department director they are necessary for the proper handling of liquid wastes containing floatable grease in excessive amounts as specified in b or any flammable wastes sand or other harmful ingredients  except that such interceptors shall not be required for private living quarters or dwelling units modifications to existing interceptors may be required when violations of this division exist all interceptors shall be of a type and capacity approved by the utility department director and shall be located as to be readily and easily accessible for cleaning and inspection in the maintaining of these interceptors the owner shall be responsible for the proper removal and disposal by appropriate means of the captured material and shall maintain records of the dates and means of disposal which are subject to review by the utility department director any removal and hauling of the collected materials not performed by the owners personnel must be performed by currently licensed waste disposal firms  1993  1983   pretreatment or flow equalizing facilitiesowner responsibility where pretreatment of flow equalizing facilities are provided or required for any waters or wastes they shall be maintained continuously in satisfactory and effective operation by the owners at his expense  1983   industrial waste monitoring device when required by the city the owner of any property serviced by a building sewer carrying industrial wastes shall install a suitable structure together with such necessary meters and other appurtenances in the building sewer to facilitate observation sampling and measurement of the wastes such structure when required shall be accessible to city personnel and safely located and shall be constructed in accordance with plans approved by the community development department the structure shall be installed by the owner at hisher expense and shall be maintained by himher so as to be safe and accessible at all times part 1997  1983   tests and sampling standards all measurements tests and analysis of the characteristics of waters and wastes to which reference is made in this chapter shall be determined in accordance with the latest edition of standard methods for the examination of water and wastewater published by the american public health association sampling methods location times duration and frequencies are to be determined on an individual basis subject to approval by the utility department director  1983   special arrangements for industrial users no statement contained in this chapter shall be construed as preventing any special agreement or arrangement between the city and any industrial concern whereby an industrial waste of unusual strength or character may be accepted by the city for treatment  1983 user charge system   purpose it is determined and declared to be necessary and conducive to the protection of the public health safety and welfare to collect charges from all users who contribute wastewater to the citys treatment works the proceeds of such charges so derived will be used for the purpose of operation and maintenance and other related costs as determined by the city council for such public wastewater treatment works  1983   generation of revenue the user charge system shall generate adequate annual revenues to pay costs of annual operation and maintenance including replacement and other related sewer system costs which the city may determine by ordinance to be paid by the user charge system that portion of the total user charge which is designated for operation and maintenance including replacement of the treatment works shall be established by ordinance  1983   basis of user feefee structure all users within the citys service area shall be assessed a monthly sewer user rate consisting of a customer service charge and a volume charge a the customer service charge shall be assessed to recover costs that apply equally to each user of the system regardless of volume contribution it shall be billed on a customer account basis b the volume charge shall be the amount charged a customer for the quantity of wastewater contributed to the citys system during a billing period 1 for the singlefamily residential and multifamily residential users this fee shall be based on the average water used by that user during the winter quarter december january and february as measured at the dwelling by the city water meter a singlefamily residential and multifamily residential user may submit a written request to the city administrator or designated representative to use alternate months for the averaging period the city administrator or designated representative is authorized to substitute different month of a calendar year to obtain a three 3 month averaging period to calculate the annual sewer average for the user and adjust the sewer user fee accordingly the following situations may be considered by the city administrator or designated representative to select an alternate month to be used for the recalculation of the sewer user fee weather conditions shutoff of service new ownership irrigation or leaks within the users dwelling the city administrator or designated representative may utilize the prior years average when a three 3 month averaging period cannot be determined due to the situations noted herein 2 for singlefamily residential users not having a winter water consumption history their sewer bill for the first month of service and every month thereafter shall be based on the number of reported occupants times two thousand 2000 gallons per occupant per month with a minimum implied water usage of two thousand 2000 gallons per month after a period of three 3 full months as measured at the dwelling by the city water meter a singlefamily residential user may submit a written request to the city administrator or designated representative for a review of the average sewer consumption used by the user the city administrator or designated representative will calculate the annual sewer average based on this period of three 3 full months and adjust the sewer user fee accordingly for multifamily residential users not having a winter water consumption history the sewer average shall be based on the previous owners average when a previous owners average is not available due to new construction or shut off of services the sewer average shall be based on the number of reported occupants for all units times two thousand 2000 gallons per occupant with a minimum implied water usage of two thousand 2000 gallons per unit per month otherwise the assigned average monthly water consumption will be used until such time as a winter quarter water consumption history is obtained for the individual user 3 for residential users who purchase and move to another property within the city the established volume charge will be transferred to the new property c charges shall be made in accordance with the provisions of this chapter and the following schedule 1 residential  single family  multifamily customer service charge $ per account $348 volume charge $ per 1000 gallons or any portion thereof based on winter quarter average $613 2 commercial customer service charge $ per account per month $348 volume charge $ per 1000 gallons or any portion thereof based on monthly water usage $613 rates are current as of  and are subject to modification by resolution pursuant to subsection d d the rates and charges established in this section may be modified by a resolution adopted and ratified by the governing body the rates so determined shall remain in effect until or unless revised by any subsequent resolution the governing body may further review and adjust such charges during the budgetary process as is necessary in order to meet the anticipated expenditures of the department the rates so determined shall remain in effect until or unless revised in any subsequent year e a resolution shall be presented for governing body action to ratify said adjustments the governing body may further review and adjust such charges during the budgetary process as is necessary in order to meet the anticipated expenditures of the department the rates so determined shall remain in effect until or unless revised in any subsequent year part 2008  part 2008    part 2003  part meter installation and repair or replacement for additional provisions concerning water meter installation and property owner responsibilities see  such meter shall be read on a monthly basis to determine volume charge for the purpose of billing for wastewater contribution to the citys system the fee structure shall be in accordance with this code b any residential user served by the wastewater system of the city who is not served by the water system of the city shall be charged a monthly volume charge based upon the citywide average residential water consumption of the winter quarter this volume rate will be adjusted annually in conjunction with the annual sewer rate calculation for residential users served by the city water system part 2008  part 1997 part 1994   surcharge for excess bod or suspended solids a for those contributors who contribute wastewater the strength of which is greater than the upper limit of normal domestic sewage a surcharge in addition to the normal charge will be collected this surcharge shall be determined by the town based on estimates of treatment costs of excess bod and ss concentrations at the time such contributors are connected to the towns wastewater treatment system b any user which discharges any toxic pollutants which cause an increase in the cost of managing the effluent or the sludge from the towns treatment works or any user which discharges any substance which singly or by interaction with other substances causes identifiable increases in the cost of operation maintenance or replacement of the treatment works shall pay for such increased costs the strength of effluent shall be determined by the responsible plant operating personnel and users shall be charged the additional surcharge rates as provided by ordinance  1983   septic waste disposal facility user fees user fees for septic waste disposal shall be based on the estimated operation and maintenance costs for the septic waste disposal facility and shall be established by resolution of the city council such fees shall be reviewed annually to assure equity of the system and to assure that sufficient funds will be collected from the system to adequately operate and maintain the septic waste disposal facility failure to conduct the annual review shall be grounds for the initiation of a current review process only and shall not invalidate existing fee schedules which shall remain in effect until modified by affirmative council action  1993   sewer plant investment feesamountresponsibility a all charges for connection to the citys subsequent year e a resolution shall be presented for governing body action to ratify said adjustments the governing body may further review and adjust such charges during the budgetary process as is 1983  7252011   replacement account the city will establish and maintain a funded replacement reserve throughout the useful life of the wastewater collection and treatment works one hundred percent 100% of the estimated annual depreciation expense per year shall be credited to this reserve until a total of one million dollars $100000000 is accumulated this account may be used for replacement or repairs necessary to assure the collection and treatment works reaching their useful life in the event any portion of the fund is used deposits shall be resumed to maintain the balance of one million dollars $100000000 part 1997   1983 billingcallout feesright to discontinue service   billing status it is the responsibility of each property owner or tenant to notify the city of intent to change name discontinue begin or in any way alter billing requirements the application for service or for change of name or billing shall be made upon the appropriate forms available at city hall part 2008  1983   vacant units vacant units will not be charged for sewer service if the water service is discontinued by the city and the city has been properly informed in writing that a unit is or will be vacant for a period of at least thirty 30 days after notification of discontinuance the water at the residence shall be shut off at the curb part 1997 part 1990  1983   monthly billing dates and delinquent account a property owner shall be responsible for payment of all utility bills unless property owner assigns tenant responsibility for payment of such bills such assignment shall be in writing all utility bills shall be sent to the property owner or tenant on a monthly basis all monthly charges for wastewater services shall be due and payable on the twentieth of each month if payment is not made by the twentieth of the month the account shall be deemed delinquent if payment is not received within thirty 30 days after initial billing a letter shall be sent to the owner and tenant at the mailing addresses on file the letter shall state 1 that the account is delinquent  2 that if the account is not paid in full on or before sixty 60 days after the initial billing giving the date of the sixtieth day the account shall be deemed in default and services discontinued  and 3 that the bill may be contested or challenged by contacting the city finance office giving address and telephone number prior to the fiftieth day after initial billing giving the date of the fiftieth day if payment of the account in full is not received or if the account is not settled within sixty 60 days after initial billing the account shall be deemed in default and services discontinued b any residential or commercial property owner or tenant who has had service discontinued for nonpayment of utility charges shall pay the bill in its entirety for all utility charges including water sewer garbage landfill pest control etc and shall deposit with the city a sum equivalent to two 2 times the average monthly bill for all municipal utility services for that property prior to service being restored c users served by the city water system shall have water shutoff for nonpayment of utility charges at the time of turnon of service the property owner shall be assessed the applicable fees and deposit as specified in  d users not served by the city water system shall be subject to discontinuance of service by capping of their wastewater service line by the utility department such discontinuance shall require the express authorization of the city administrator prior to capping if services are restored during regular working hours of utility department staff the turnon fee shall be one hundred dollars $10000 if wastewater service has been capped if services are restored during other than regular working hours the turnon fee shall be one hundred fifty dollars $15000 if wastewater service has been capped at the time of turnon of service the property owner shall be assessed the deposit as specified in e the deposit shall be held for a period of one 1 year if the property owner or tenant demonstrates good faith in payment of bills in a timely fashion the deposit shall be returned f if the property owner or tenant cannot demonstrate good faith in payment of bills the deposit shall be held by the city until such time of final billing final billing shall be made and deducted from moneys on deposit and any balance returned to the property owner or tenant the property owner or tenant shall be responsible for the payment of the final bill in total if the deposit does not fully satisfy the debt to the city part 2008   part 1997  part 1994     1983   improper wastewater use a any person who discharges wastewater into the citys wastewater system without first having established an account shall pay the city a flat monthly rate based on the average monthly volume contributed for that customer class for the number of months person has so discharged in addition it shall be unlawful for any person to knowingly discharge wastewater into the citys wastewater system without first having established an account a violation of this subsection shall result in a fine not to exceed seven hundred fifty dollars $75000 for such unlawful usage of city wastewater system b the city administrator shall be authorized to direct that sewer service line serving such premises is capped until any past charges fees andor penalties are paid part 1994   utility callout fees the city shall assess a callout fee for emergency service rendered after hours on weekends or holidays the amount of the callout fee shall be established by resolution of the city council and shall take into account the cost of prevailing wages for utility department employees together with the appropriate benefit calculation billing to person requesting said callout shall be made by finance department upon receipt of billing information from public utility department such fees shall be reviewed and revised as necessary on an annual basis failure to conduct the annual review shall be grounds for the initiation of a current review process only and shall not invalidate existing fee schedules which shall remain in effect until modified by affirmative council action  1993 division iii  sanitation collection and solid waste disposal facility  prior ordinance history ords 649 631 625 576 447 435 and 389 general requirements and information   duties of governing body subject to the laws relating to public utilities the governing body shall fix all rates for sanitation and solid waste facility services within and outside the corporate limits of the city and make regulations for the collection of the fees and charges part 2004   powers and duties of city administrator the city administrator or hisher authorized representative shall enforce all necessary rules regulations and penalties to enforce the collection of fees and for the protection of the citys property and rights pertaining to the citys sanitation collection and solid waste disposal system part 2004   responsibilities of public works department director the public works director shall be responsible for the management and direction of the citys sanitation and solid waste collection and disposal system and for the operation of the municipal solid waste disposal facilities part 2004   definitions a constructiondemolition waste includes but is not limited to stone wood concrete asphaltic concrete cinder blocks plaster and metal b debris means discarded automobile parts household appliances furniture construction materials dead animals or any other materials too large to be disposed of in a standard solid waste container or which may be inappropriate for deposit in a regular solid waste disposal pit c hazardous waste means any waste or combination of wastes which pose a substantial present or potential hazard to human health or the environment as defined as hazardous wastes in wyoming department of environmental quality hazardous waste rules and regulations identification and listing of hazardous waste d recyclable materials means paper products aluminum glass plastics metal cans or newspapers which can be diverted from the waste stream e scavenging means the unauthorized removal of solid waste or debris from the landfill site after it has been collected and deposited in accordance with division iii of this title f solid waste means any and all kitchen refuse waste food offal or animal matter or anything else whatsoever which may decompose and become offensive unsanitary or dangerous to health  or any other refuse such as paper products cans bottles or other waste materials which may be safely and conveniently disposed of in a standard solid waste container g yard waste means leaves or grass clippings suitable for composting part 2004   1 8222016   collectionintervals all solid waste shall be collected and disposed of by employees of the city and at regular intervals as prescribed in collection of solid waste is subject to restrictions as per no person except the employees of the city or persons under contract with the city for such purposes shall collect and transport any solid waste from cityowned containers part 2004   damaging solid waste containers no person shall in any manner tamper with deface or destroy any solid waste container belonging to the city any person found guilty of these acts shall be subject to a maximum fine of seven hundred fifty dollars $75000 for each such container damaged part 2004 containerscollection   containers requiredspecifications a every owner or occupant of any occupied premises within the city shall obtain and utilize solid waste containers provided by the city one 1 onehundred 100 gallon rollout will be provided to residential users in areas without alleys one and onehalf 1 12 yard or three 3 yard dumpsters will be used in residential areas with alleys one and onehalf 1 12 yard dumpsters are designed to be shared by two 2 residences three 3 yard dumpsters by four 4 residences b residential users who desire more than the allocated container capacity may request additional rollout dumpsters as appropriate charges for additional containers shall be as in c the city shall provide dumpster capacity as is necessary to accommodate commercial premises at such collection intervals as are established for such premises part 2004   ownership of containers the city shall provide rollout containers or dumpsters for all premises served by the citys sanitation collection system such containers or dumpsters shall be provided to all users within the corporate limits of the city all dumpsters and rollout containers remain the property of the city part 2004   responsibility of owner to maintain container it shall be the duty of every user of the citys sanitation collection system to maintain the rollout container or dumpster in good order and to notify the public works department of necessary repairs the public works department will repair or replace containers or dumpsters as needed costs of repair if necessary due to negligence or willful destruction on the part of the user shall be itemized and charged to the user as an additional cost of service part 2004   use of containerscollection generally a it shall be the duty of every owner or occupant of any premises within the city limits to deposit in the appropriate container all solid waste produced at or brought into any such premise b all solid waste must be in paper or plastic bags tied securely and placed in the container no container shall be allowed to overflow so that solid waste may be blown or scattered about in any way c no debris or excessively heavy yard waste shall be placed in any dumpster or rollout container as such materials can damage container andor mechanical parts of the sanitation truck for regulations concerning removal of debris see d users of the citys sanitation system are required to separate yard waste and are encouraged to separate recyclable materials out of the solid waste deposited into city containers and place same in receptacles specifically designed for such use e no person shall deposit any solid waste or other debris in anothers solid waste container unless the consent of the property owner or occupant of the premises is first obtained yard waste shall not be permitted in any containers other than those designated for such use solid waste containers located on public property are designed for visitors and specific users of such public property and are not designed for the regular deposit of solid waste by noncity residents part 2004   2 8222016   placement of containers a dumpsters shall be located in alleys at positions determined by the public works department to facilitate ease of route flow b dumpsters on commercial property parking lots shall be placed in a three 3 sided enclosure to screen the dumpster from public view plans for the enclosure shall be approved by the public works director and are the responsibility of the developer to install and maintain to city specifications c rollout containers shall be placed in the gutter in front of the residence by seven  am on the designated collection day no person shall place the rollout in the street prior to one 1 calendar day before the collection of the solid waste nor shall any person leave the rollout in the street more than twentyfour 24 hours after collection d no vehicle shall be parked so as to obstruct access by sanitation collection crews to any dumpster or rollout part 2004   frequency of collection a residential the collection of solid waste in residential areas shall be made once a week according to route schedules determined by the public works director b commercial the collection of solid waste for commercial properties shall be made daily or at other reasonable intervals as requested part 2004   collection services outside the city limits a collection outside the city limits may be requested allowance of the collection shall be at the discretion of the public works director taking into consideration such factors as proximity to city limits access to property and service to other property in the area to be served b users outside the corporate limits of the city shall be charged the monthly rates set forth in a with the exception of the volume charge which shall be double those set forth in the fee schedule  part 2004 solid waste disposal facility operation debris accumulation and removal   accumulation of solid waste or debris unlawful it is unlawful for any person owning or occupying a lot or premises or for that persons agent to permit or cause the accumulation of solid waste or debris upon the lot or premises including that property up to the center line of any alley bordering property such accumulation has been declared a nuisance pursuant to part 2004   responsibility for removal removal of debris or solid waste that does not fit in designated solid waste containers shall be the responsibility of the property owner or occupant such debris or solid waste shall be removed and dumped in an approved solid waste disposal facility if material is left outside of containers dumpsters or rollouts which must be manually placed in the sanitation truck the owner of the property may be assessed an additional cleanup fee for manpower and equipment time at the rate set forth in part 2004   3 8222016   solid waste disposal facility regulations a individuals using the city solid waste facility shall observe all regulations of that facility b all material deposited in the solid waste facility must be in the designated pit it is unlawful to dump solid waste or debris outside the solid waste facility or in any location within the solid waste facility that has not been designated for such dumping c it is unlawful to dispose of any hazardous waste as defined in c within the solid waste facility d all loads are subject to inspection by designated city officials in accordance with state and federal regulations e the public works director is authorized to temporarily suspend operations at the solid waste disposal facility due to high wind or muddy conditions that make daily operation difficult part 2004   transporting of solid waste or debris to prevent scattering of solid waste and debris all persons transporting solid waste debris or recyclable materials to the solid waste facility or any recycling location must cover the load with a tarp wire mesh or some other means which prevents the material from blowing or falling out of the vehicle any person traveling to the solid waste facility without meeting the provisions of this section may be assessed a fee as set forth in addition to any other fees assessed part 2004   4 8222016   scavenging unlawfulsolid waste property of city all solid waste or debris becomes the property of the city when it is deposited in the solid waste facility no scavenging shall be permitted by any person part 2004 user charge system   generation of revenue the user charge system shall generate adequate revenues to pay all costs of operation and maintenance as determined by generally accepted accounting principles including equipment replacement and capital improvements part 2004   billing status it is the responsibility of each property owner or tenant to notify the city of intent to change name discontinue begin or in any way alter billing requirements application forms to obtain modify or discontinue a service account shall be available at city hall part 2008 part 2004   rates and chargessanitation collection and solid waste disposal a all users of the citys sanitation
